Reliable Transactions in Serverless-Edge Architecture
无服务器边缘架构中的可靠事务

Suyash Gupta*, Sajjad Rahnama, Erik Linsenmayer, Faisal Nawabi, Mohammad Sadoghi
Suyash Gupta*、Sajjad Rahnama、Eric Linsenmayer、Faisal Nawabi、Mohammad Sadoghi
Exploratory Systems Lab 探索系统实验室
University of California, Davis
加州大学戴维斯分校
† University of California,Irvine
† 加州大学欧文分校
*University of California, Berkeley Abstract-Modern edge applications demand novel solutions where edge applications do not have to rely on a single cloud provider (which cannot be in the vicinity of every edge device) or dedicated edge servers (which cannot scale as clouds) for process- ing compute-intensive tasks. A recent computing philosophy, Sky computing, proposes giving each user ability to select between available cloud providers.
*加州大学伯克利分校摘要-现代边缘应用程序需要新颖的解决方案，其中边缘应用程序不必依赖单个云提供商（不能位于每个边缘设备附近）或专用边缘服务器（不能像云一样扩展）用于处理计算密集型任务。最近的计算理念“天空计算”提出让每个用户能够在可用的云提供商之间进行选择。
In this paper, we present our serverless-edge co-design, which extends the Sky computing vision. In our serverless-edge co- design, we expect edge devices to collaborate and spawn required number of serverless functions. This raises several key challenges: (1) how will this collaboration take place, (2) what if some edge devices are compromised, and (3) what if a selected cloud provider is malicious. Hence, we design SERVERLESSBFT, the first protocol to guarantee Byzantine fault-tolerant (BFT) transactional flow between edge devices and serverless functions. We present an exhaustive list of attacks and their solutions on our serverless-edge co-design. Further, we extensively benchmark our architecture on a variety of parameters.
在本文中，我们介绍了我们的无服务器边缘协同设计，它扩展了 Sky 计算的愿景。在我们的无服务器边缘协同设计中，我们期望边缘设备能够协作并产生所需数量的无服务器功能。这提出了几个关键挑战：(1) 这种协作将如何进行，(2) 如果某些边缘设备受到损害怎么办，以及 (3) 如果选定的云提供商是恶意的怎么办。因此，我们设计了 SERVERLESSBFT，这是第一个保证边缘设备和无服务器功能之间拜占庭容错 (BFT) 事务流的协议。我们在无服务器边缘协同设计中提供了详尽的攻击及其解决方案列表。此外，我们还根据各种参数对我们的架构进行了广泛的基准测试。
Index Terms-edge computing, serverless, IoT
索引术语-边缘计算、无服务器、物联网

I. INTRODUCTION 一、简介

This paper introduces SERVERLESSBFT, the first protocol to guarantee Byzantine fault-tolerant (BFT) transactional flow between edge devices and serverless functions. The design of SERVERLESSBFT is motivated from the recent introduction of Sky Computing, which envisages utility computing in a multi-cloud environment [1], [2]. Sky computing propounds the design of an inter-cloud broker that takes as input a client program and output specifications and selects the best cloud providers to execute the client program. Such a broker is extremely desirable for the edge and Internet of Things (IoT) applications, which run on edge devices, such as smart devices, sensors, UAVs, and phones, that have limited compute power and memory [3].
本文介绍了 SERVERLESSBFT，这是第一个保证边缘设备和无服务器功能之间拜占庭容错 (BFT) 事务流的协议。 SERVERLESSBFT 的设计灵感源自最近推出的 SkyComputing，它设想了多云环境中的效用计算 [1]、[2]。天空计算提出了云间代理的设计，该代理将客户端程序作为输入和输出规范，并选择最佳的云提供商来执行客户端程序。这样的代理对于边缘和物联网 (IoT) 应用程序来说是非常理想的，这些应用程序运行在计算能力和内存有限的边缘设备上，例如智能设备、传感器、无人机和手机 [3]。
On the one hand, existing edge applications expect response latency in the order of tens of milliseconds [4], [5], [6]. On the other hand, they are forced to delegate compute-intensive tasks to a specific third-party cloud provider such as AWS and Azure [7], [8]. A recent way to solve this dilemma is to install dedicated edge-servers that are closer to the edge devices [9], [10]. These edge servers are installed and maintained by the enterprise behind the application [11], [12]. If any hardware crashes, then the enterprise may need to purchase new hard- ware. Moreover, with ever-growing application needs, these servers are impossible to seamless scale as third-party clouds.
一方面，现有的边缘应用程序预计响应延迟约为数十毫秒[4]、[5]、[6]。另一方面，他们被迫将计算密集型任务委托给特定的第三方云提供商，例如 AWS 和 Azure [7]、[8]。解决这一困境的最新方法是安装更靠近边缘设备的专用边缘服务器[9]、[10]。这些边缘服务器由应用程序背后的企业安装和维护[11]、[12]。如果任何硬件崩溃，那么企业可能需要购买新硬件。此外，随着应用需求的不断增长，这些服务器不可能像第三方云那样无缝扩展。
SERVERLESSBFT realizes the Sky computing vision in edge computing by giving the edge applications flexibility to select any of the available cloud providers. As a result, the edge application can select different cloud providers based on the location of its users. 1 However,moving data across cloud providers degrades system performance and is expensive. So, we take a step further and permit edge applications to make use of serverless technology, which (i) decouples storage, compute, and network, (ii) supports pay-as-you-go model where the enterprise pays only for the resources used, and (iii) supports auto-scaling policies [14], [15]. We refer to this interaction as serverless-edge co-design as it promotes light-weight tasks at the edge while compute-intensive tasks are done at the serverless cloud. Our serverless-edge co- design targets low latency by allowing edge devices to spawn serverless functions at the nearest cloud.
SERVERLESSBFT 使边缘应用程序能够灵活地选择任何可用的云提供商，从而实现边缘计算中的 Sky 计算愿景。因此，边缘应用程序可以根据用户的位置选择不同的云提供商。 1 但是，跨云提供商移动数据会降低系统性能并且成本高昂。因此，我们更进一步，允许边缘应用程序利用无服务器技术，该技术（i）解耦存储、计算和网络，（ii）支持即用即付模式，企业只需为资源付费使用，以及（iii）支持自动扩展策略[14]，[15]。我们将这种交互称为无服务器边缘协同设计，因为它促进边缘的轻量级任务，而计算密集型任务则在无服务器云中完成。我们的无服务器边缘协同设计通过允许边缘设备在最近的云中生成无服务器功能来实现低延迟。
Our serverless-edge co-design also presents several research challenges, which we enlist next.
我们的无服务器边缘协同设计还提出了一些研究挑战，我们接下来将讨论这些挑战。
(1) Task distribution between edge and serverless. Our SERVERLESSBFT protocol requires an edge application to push its compute-intensive task to the cloud by spawning serverless functions (for simplicity, we refer to these functions as executors). To do so, we need to design a compatibility layer. We build this compatibility layer on top of edge devices and refer to it as a shim. At shim, the edge devices collab- orate and spawn serverless executors for executing compute- intensive client requests.
(1)边缘和无服务器之间的任务分配。我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议需要边缘应用程序通过生成无服务器函数（为简单起见，我们将这些函数称为执行器）将其计算密集型任务推送到云端。为此，我们需要设计一个兼容层。我们在边缘设备之上构建此兼容性层，并将其称为垫片。在 shim 中，边缘设备协作并生成无服务器执行器来执行计算密集型客户端请求。
(2) Lack of Trust at Shim. As edge devices may belong to different parties, which may not trust each other, it is hard for these devices to collaborate. Hence, our SERVERLESSBFT protocol runs a traditional BFT protocol to allow these edge devices reach a consensus [16], [17]. This consensus decides which edge device will spawn the desired number of executors and the order in which client requests are processed. For consensus, we opt for BFT protocols as they are resilient to malicious attacks. Further, depending on the location and nature of edge devices, SERVERLESSBFT permits various shim designs: a single shim of all devices running PBFT [16]
(2) 对 Shim 缺乏信任。由于边缘设备可能属于不同的各方，彼此之间可能不信任，因此这些设备很难协作。因此，我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议运行传统的 BFT 协议，以允许这些边缘设备达成共识 [16]、[17]。这种共识决定哪个边缘设备将产生所需数量的执行器以及处理客户端请求的顺序。为了达成共识，我们选择 BFT 协议，因为它们能够抵御恶意攻击。此外，根据边缘设备的位置和性质，SERVERLESSBFT 允许各种垫片设计：运行 PBFT 的所有设备的单个垫片 [16]
1 At present,switching cloud providers is common for most applications due to geo-political reasons and government regulations [13].
1 目前，由于地缘政治原因和政府法规，大多数应用程序更换云提供商很常见[13]。
consensus, multiple dependent shims of devices spread glob- ally, running GeoBFT [17], and multiple independent shims running AHL [18], Sharper [19], or RingBFT [20]. For sim- plicity,in this paper,we assume a single shim of 3f+1 devices where up to f devices can act malicious.
共识，设备的多个相关垫片分布在全球，运行 GeoBFT [17]，以及多个运行 AHL [18]、Sharper [19] 或 RingBFT [20] 的独立垫片。为了简单起见，在本文中，我们假设有 3f+1 个设备的单个 shim，其中最多 f 个设备可以进行恶意行为。
(3) Lack of Trust at Serverless cloud. Depending on the application requirement, shim may spawn serverless executors at one or more available cloud providers in the vicinity. Hence, there is again a lack of trust: some cloud providers may have mal-intent or may have poor QoS (crashed or failed executors) [21], [22]. As a result, SERVERLESSBFT requires the shim to spawn 2f+1 executors and permits up to f of them to fail. This extra spawning is not new; Yahoo's Hadoop also executes the same code multiple times to reduce latency due to stragglers [23].
(3) 无服务器云缺乏信任。根据应用程序要求，shim 可能会在附近的一个或多个可用云提供商处生成无服务器执行器。因此，再次缺乏信任：一些云提供商可能有恶意，或者服务质量较差（执行程序崩溃或失败）[21]、[22]。因此，SERVERLESSBFT 需要垫片生成 2f+1 个执行程序，并允许最多 f 个执行程序失败。这种额外的产卵现象并不新鲜。雅虎的 Hadoop 还多次执行相同的代码，以减少由于落后者造成的延迟 [23]。
(4) Private Data access and retrieval. Recent reports illus- trate that around 90% of the industries are not only sticking with their existing on-premise servers, but also scaling them up [24],[25]. For at least 65% of these industries,the key reason for maintaing on-premise servers is to protect their consumer data from data-breaches and attacks [24]. In our serverless-edge co-design, we adhere to this design choice and assume that all the client data is stored in an on-premise storage at the enterprise. As a result, the enterprise can control access to the data. Hence, edge devices or executors lack rights to update the storage, but may request read access to the same. For updates to the storage, we write a lightweight wrapper (verifier) around the storage that collects execution results, updates the data-store, and forwards the results to the clients.
(4) 私有数据访问和检索。最近的报告表明，大约 90% 的行业不仅坚持使用现有的本地服务器，而且还对其进行扩展[24]，[25]。至少对于这些行业中的 65% 来说，维护本地服务器的关键原因是保护其消费者数据免受数据泄露和攻击[24]。在我们的无服务器边缘协同设计中，我们坚持这种设计选择，并假设所有客户端数据都存储在企业的本地存储中。因此，企业可以控制对数据的访问。因此，边缘设备或执行器缺乏更新存储的权限，但可以请求对其进行读取访问。为了更新存储，我们在存储周围编写一个轻量级包装器（验证器），用于收集执行结果、更新数据存储并将结果转发给客户端。
Furthermore, we observe several other new challenges with our architecture: (i) Byzantine shim devices may spawn less executors, for which we need to hold them accountable. (ii) During execution, executors may need to read data from the storage. (iii) If the client transactions are conflicting and their read-write sets are unknown until execution, we may have to abort such transactions.
此外，我们还观察到我们的架构面临的其他几个新挑战：（i）拜占庭 shim 设备可能会产生更少的执行器，为此我们需要让它们负责。 (ii) 在执行过程中，执行器可能需要从存储中读取数据。 (iii) 如果客户端事务存在冲突并且它们的读写集在执行之前未知，我们可能不得不中止此类事务。
We envision our serverless-edge architecture to seamlessly integrate with existing edge applications. To realize this goal experimentally, we design a shim of nodes and require them to spawn AWS Lambda functions as executors. On each shim node, we install RESILIENTDB's light-weight and multi- threaded consensus framework [17], [26], [27], [28], [29]. We evaluate our SERVERLESSBFT protocol on eight distinct parameters. Our results illustrate that SERVERLESSBFT can facilitate shims of up to 128 devices in 11 global regions. Further, in our experiments, we are easily able to spawn 21 executors in parallel (could not scale further due to limits by cloud provider), and the peak throughput achieved by our SERVERLESSBFT protocol is 240 k txns/s while the minimum latency incurred is 30 ms .
我们设想我们的无服务器边缘架构能够与现有边缘应用程序无缝集成。为了通过实验实现这一目标，我们设计了一个节点垫片，并要求它们生成 AWS Lambda 函数作为执行器。在每个 shim 节点上，我们安装 RESILIENTDB 的轻量级多线程共识框架 [17]、[26]、[27]、[28]、[29]。我们根据八个不同的参数评估我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议。我们的结果表明，SERVERLESSBFT 可以促进全球 11 个区域中多达 128 台设备的垫片。此外，在我们的实验中，我们可以轻松地并行生成 21 个执行程序（由于云提供商的限制，无法进一步扩展），并且我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议实现的峰值吞吐量为 240 k txns/s，而产生的最小延迟为 30 ms 。
In this paper, we make the following contributions:
在本文中，我们做出以下贡献：
  • We design of a novel serverless-edge co-design that meets the vision of Sky computing and helps design low latency reliable edge applications where edge devices can select cloud providers based on desired output specifications.
    我们设计了一种新颖的无服务器边缘协同设计，可以满足天空计算的愿景，并帮助设计低延迟可靠的边缘应用程序，其中边缘设备可以根据所需的输出规格选择云提供商。
Fig. 1. Illustration of (a) Serverless-Edge architecture employing the SERVER- LESSBFT protocol and (b) architecture prevalent in existing edge applications.
图 1. (a) 采用 SERVER-LESSBFT 协议的无服务器边缘架构和 (b) 现有边缘应用程序中普遍存在的架构的图示。
  • In our serverless-edge architecture, we neither trust the edge devices nor the serverless executors. Hence, we introduce a novel protocol SERVERLESSBFT that manages the flow of a client request in our serverless-edge architecture and shields the system against arbitrary results and malicious attacks.
    在我们的无服务器边缘架构中，我们既不信任边缘设备，也不信任无服务器执行器。因此，我们引入了一种新颖的协议 SERVERLESSBFT，它可以管理无服务器边缘架构中的客户端请求流，并保护系统免受任意结果和恶意攻击。
  • We enlist possible attacks in our serverless-edge architec- ture and present solutions to recover the system.
    我们在无服务器边缘架构中列出了可能的攻击，并提供了恢复系统的解决方案。
  • Our ServerLessBFT protocol presents algorithms to handle conflicting transactions with or without the knowledge of read-write available to shim nodes prior to execution.
    我们的 ServerLessBFT 协议提供了处理冲突事务的算法，无论执行前是否知道 shim 节点可用的读写。

II. MOTIVATION AND USE CASE
二.动机和用例

The motivations behind our serverless-edge co-design are the emerging use cases of edge-computing, such as AR/VR video-streaming and Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). These applications require massive data-processing as they need to run ML models to train data on-flight or provide the user useful insights. The key challenge these applications face is the rapidly changing user characteristics.
我们无服务器边缘协同设计背后的动机是边缘计算的新兴用例，例如 AR/VR 视频流和无人机 (UAV)。这些应用程序需要大量数据处理，因为它们需要运行机器学习模型来训练动态数据或为用户提供有用的见解。这些应用程序面临的主要挑战是快速变化的用户特征。
We consider a real-world use case of UAVs as a motivating example for this work [30]. In recent years, UAVs have been adopted by e-commerce industries, such as Amazon and Walmart, for product deliveries. These UAVs help to securely and quickly transport user goods in a cost-efficient manner. During the delivery process, each UAV travels over multiple geographical locations and performs an array of tasks, such as navigation, image recognition, and live video-streaming.
我们考虑无人机的现实世界用例作为这项工作的激励示例[30]。近年来，亚马逊和沃尔玛等电子商务行业采用无人机进行产品交付。这些无人机有助于以经济高效的方式安全、快速地运输用户货物。在交付过程中，每架无人机都会飞越多个地理位置并执行一系列任务，例如导航、图像识别和实时视频流。
In Figure 1(b), we illustrate the traditional way of computing for UAVs, where each UAV offloads all the collected data to the dedicated edge servers for processing. In this model, UAVs are forced to communicate with dedicated servers. When the server is in the vicinity, the communication round-trip costs are low; otherwise, they are high. Each edge server executes the
在图 1(b) 中，我们展示了无人机的传统计算方式，其中每个无人机将所有收集到的数据卸载到专用边缘服务器进行处理。在这种模型中，无人机被迫与专用服务器进行通信。当服务器就近时，通信往返成本较低；否则，它们就很高。每个边缘服务器执行
requests from various UAVs in an ordered-fashion. Moreover, these servers need to be continuously scaled, new software needs to be installed, and OS needs to be updated, which makes them a financially expensive choice.
各种无人机以有序的方式发出请求。此外，这些服务器需要不断扩展，需要安装新软件，并且需要更新操作系统，这使得它们成为经济上昂贵的选择。
In Figure 1(a), we reimagine the UAV delivery operation in our serverless-edge co-design. Switching to our serverless- edge model, allows UAVs in the vicinity to interact with each other and act as a shim that spawns serverless executors to process collected data. To alleviate concerns regarding round- trip costs, the shim is permitted to opt for services from local cloud providers. In fact, shim can spawn executors at multiple clouds and wait for whichever responds earliest. As there is a lack of trust among shim devices and executors, we have our SERVERLESSBFT protocol to manage all the transactional flow in a byzantine fault-tolerant manner.
在图 1(a) 中，我们在无服务器边缘协同设计中重新构想了无人机交付操作。切换到我们的无服务器边缘模型，允许附近的无人机相互交互，并充当垫片，生成无服务器执行器来处理收集的数据。为了减轻对往返成本的担忧，垫片可以选择本地云提供商的服务。事实上，shim 可以在多个云中生成执行器，并等待最早响应的那个。由于 shim 设备和执行器之间缺乏信任，我们有 SERVERLESSBFT 协议来以拜占庭容错方式管理所有事务流。
Byzantine failures in the wild. Do real-world systems face more than just crash failures? Unfortunately, yes. Exist- ing systems suffer from omission failures where nodes can crash [31], and arbitrary failures where nodes can act in an unexpected manner [21]. Almost all real-world applications handle omission failures using protocols based on Paxos- family [32], [33]. However, the true challenge is to bulwark the system system against often overlooked arbitrary fail- ures: Google's UpRight [21] provides fault-tolerance against byzantine failures, Google has also observed corrupt execution errors [22], and Cloudflare observed a misbehaving switch sending incorrect messages [34]. Hence, it is better to guard system against these failures.
拜占庭在野外的失败。现实世界的系统面临的不仅仅是崩溃故障吗？不幸的是，是的。现有系统会遭受遗漏故障（节点可能崩溃）[31]，以及任意故障（节点可能以意外方式运行）[21]。几乎所有现实世界的应用程序都使用基于 Paxos 系列的协议来处理遗漏故障[32]、[33]。然而，真正的挑战是保护系统免受经常被忽视的任意故障的影响：Google 的 UpRight [21] 提供针对拜占庭故障的容错能力，Google 还观察到损坏的执行错误 [22]，并且 Cloudflare 观察到行为不当的交换机发送错误的消息[34]。因此，最好防止系统出现这些故障。

III. Preliminaries 三．预赛

We make standard assumptions as made by any BFT sys- tem [16], [17], [19], [26]. We represent our serverless-edge architecture A through a quintuple, A={C,R,E,S,V} , where we use C to denote the set of clients, R to denote the shim of edge devices or nodes, E to denote the serverless executors, V and S to denote the verifier and data-store. As described in Section I, we assume an on-premise data-store maintained by the enterprise, while the verifier is a lightweight wrapper around the data-store. Hence, both verifier and storage are assumed to be honest and trusted.
我们做出任何 BFT 系统 [16]、[17]、[19]、[26] 所做的标准假设。我们通过五元组 A={C,R,E,S,V} 表示我们的无服务器边缘架构 A ，其中我们使用 C 表示客户端集 R 表示边缘设备或节点的垫片， E 表示无服务器执行器， V 和 S 表示验证器和数据存储。如第一节所述，我们假设企业维护本地数据存储，而验证器是数据存储的轻量级包装器。因此，验证者和存储都被认为是诚实和可信的。
Fault-Tolerance Requirement at Shim. We use the notation nR=|R| to represent total number of edge nodes in A . At most fR of these nodes are byzantine and can crash-fail or act arbitrarily; nR≥3fR+1 . The remaining 2fR+1 nodes are honest and follow the protocol.
Shim 的容错要求。我们使用符号 nR=|R| 来表示 A 中边缘节点的总数。这些节点最多 fR 是拜占庭式的，可能会崩溃、失败或任意行动； nR≥3fR+1 。其余的 2fR+1 节点是诚实的并遵循协议。
Authenticated Communication. To exchange messages among different components, we employ Digital Signatures (DS) and Message Authentication Codes (MAC) [35]. To represent a message m signed by a component R using DS,we use the notation ⟨m⟩R . Anyone who has the signer’s public- key can verify this signature. One of the common ways to exchange public-keys is through a public-key certificates [36].
认证通信。为了在不同组件之间交换消息，我们采用数字签名（DS）和消息认证码（MAC）[35]。为了表示由组件 R 使用 DS 签名的消息 m ，我们使用符号 ⟨m⟩R 。任何拥有签名者公钥的人都可以验证此签名。交换公钥的常见方法之一是通过公钥证书[36]。
For MACs, signer and verifier use a common key, which is kept secret. We use Diffie-Hellman key exchange for securely sharing secret keys. In rest of the text,any message m that does not indicate the identity of the signer implies the use of MAC. Although MACs offer higher throughput than DS, DS guarantee non-repudiation [16], [37]. We also employ a collision-resistant hash function H(⋅) to map a value v to a constant-sized digest H(v) . We use a function id() to assign an identifier to each node R∈R and each executor E∈E . We assume that byzantine components can neither impersonate honest components, nor subvert cryptographic constructs. We do not make any assumptions on the behavior of the clients. We term a message as well-formed if it passes all the cryptographic and other necessary checks.
对于 MAC，签名者和验证者使用一个保密的公用密钥。我们使用 Diffie-Hellman 密钥交换来安全地共享密钥。在文本的其余部分中，任何不指示签名者身份的消息 m 都意味着使用MAC。尽管 MAC 提供比 DS 更高的吞吐量，但 DS 保证不可否认性[16]、[37]。我们还使用抗冲突哈希函数 H(⋅) 将值 v 映射到恒定大小的摘要 H(v) 。我们使用函数 id() 为每个节点 R∈R 和每个执行器 E∈E 分配一个标识符。我们假设拜占庭组件既不能冒充诚实组件，也不能破坏密码结构。我们不对客户的行为做出任何假设。如果消息通过了所有加密和其他必要的检查，我们将其称为格式良好的消息。

A. Serverless Cloud Assumptions
A. 无服务器云假设

We expect access to one or more serverless clouds such as AWS Lambda and Google Functions. These serverless cloud should permit edge nodes to seamlessly upload the desirable code or transactions for processing as per the application specifications. For simplicity, in rest of the text, we assume that the shim nodes access only one cloud provider for spawning executors to execute client transactions. However, there is no free food as these serverless clouds follow a pay- per-use model where whoever spawns executors also pays for their use [38]. We expect these clouds to meet the following:
我们期望访问一个或多个无服务器云，例如 AWS Lambda 和 Google Functions。这些无服务器云应允许边缘节点无缝上传所需的代码或事务，以便根据应用程序规范进行处理。为简单起见，在本文的其余部分中，我们假设 shim 节点仅访问一个云提供商，以生成执行器来执行客户端事务。然而，没有免费的食物，因为这些无服务器云遵循按使用付费的模型，无论谁产生执行器，也都为其使用付费[38]。我们期望这些云满足以下条件：
  • Fault-Tolerance: To handle arbitrary faults at the server- less cloud,we spawn nE≥2fE+1 executors,and assume that at most fE are byzantine. Prior works have shown that 2fE+1 executors guarantee successful execution of a transaction in the byzantine setting [39]. This leads us to observe the following:
    容错：为了处理无服务器云中的任意故障，我们生成 nE≥2fE+1 执行器，并假设最多 fE 是拜占庭的。先前的工作表明， 2fE+1 执行器保证了拜占庭设置中事务的成功执行[39]。这使我们观察到以下几点：
1) The values for fE and fR may or may not be same.
1) fE 和 fR 的值可能相同，也可能不同。
2) In Section VI, we illustrate that if the transactions are conflicting,then we need an additional fE executors to prevent an indistinguishable byzantine attack.
2）在第六节中，我们说明如果交易存在冲突，那么我们需要额外的 fE 执行器来防止难以区分的拜占庭攻击。
  • Identity: We expect each spawned executor to be assigned a unique pair of public-private key, which it uses to digitally sign a message.
    身份：我们希望为每个生成的执行程序分配一对唯一的公钥-私钥，用于对消息进行数字签名。
  • Accountability: Each executor is spawned by some shim node that pays for this service. Hence, we expect that no executor can spawn more executors. Further, the expected number of executors to be spawned by shim nodes is known to all the components of our architecture.
    责任：每个执行器都是由一些支付该服务费用的垫片节点产生的。因此，我们期望任何执行者都不能产生更多的执行者。此外，我们架构的所有组件都知道 shim 节点生成的预期执行器数量。
  • Payment. As executors are spawned by shim nodes, it implies that the spawner will be billed by the cloud provider. Hence, post successful consensus of a transaction, the edge application's enterprise pays the spawner a fixed amount to cover its expenses.
    支付。由于执行器是由 shim 节点生成的，这意味着生成器将由云提供商计费。因此，在交易成功达成共识后，边缘应用程序的企业向生成器支付固定金额以支付其费用。

IV. ARCHITECTURE 四．建筑学

We now discuss in detail the BFT transactional flow guaran- teed by our SERVERLESSBFT protocol in the serverless-edge co-design. In Figure 2, we schematically present this flow; the shim consists of nR=4 edge nodes and nE=3 executors are spawned per transaction. For understandability, we will periodically refer to the UAV use case of Section II.
现在，我们详细讨论无服务器边缘协同设计中由 SERVERLESSBFT 协议保证的 BFT 事务流。在图 2 中，我们示意性地展示了该流程； shim 由 nR=4 边缘节点组成，并且每个事务都会生成 nE=3 执行器。为了便于理解，我们将定期参考第二部分的无人机用例。
As stated earlier, shim can have different abstractions and can run any BFT protocol. In this paper, we assume a single shim of 3fR+1 and require shim nodes to run the PBFT [16] protocol. PBFT is considered as a representative BFT protocol
如前所述，shim 可以有不同的抽象，并且可以运行任何 BFT 协议。在本文中，我们假设单个垫片 3fR+1 并要求垫片节点运行 PBFT [16] 协议。 PBFT被认为是具有代表性的BFT协议
Fig. 2. Schematic representation of the transactional flow in SERVERLESS- BFT protocol. Given a client transaction T ,the nodes of the shim work together to order this transaction, following which the primary P invokes the executors at the serverless cloud to execute T . Post execution,the executors send their results to the verifier, which replies to the client.
图 2. SERVERLESS-BFT 协议中事务流程的示意图。给定一个客户端事务 T ，垫片的节点一起工作来排序该事务，随后主 P 调用无服务器云上的执行器来执行 T 。执行后，执行者将结果发送给验证者，验证者回复客户端。
as all the other protocols follow its design. PBFT protocol works in views. For each view, one node is designated as the primary and is responsible for successful completion of consensuses in that view. If the primary acts malicious, the view is changed and the primary is replaced.
因为所有其他协议都遵循其设计。 PBFT 协议在视图中工作。对于每个视图，一个节点被指定为主节点，负责成功完成该视图中的共识。如果主节点行为恶意，则视图会更改并替换主节点。

A. Client Request and Response
A. 客户端请求和响应

Any user that accesses the edge application becomes a client in our system. E.g., each UAV that requires data-processing from the cloud acts as a client and packages its request as a transaction. A client C send a message ⟨T⟩C to the primary node P2 of the current view v of the shim when it wants to process a transaction T . Notice that C employs DS to sign this message (refer to Figure 3, Line 1). The client C marks ⟨T⟩C as processed when it receives a RESPONSE message from the verifier V . As C knows that V is a trusted entity in our infrastructure, it readily accepts the response (Line 3).
任何访问边缘应用程序的用户都会成为我们系统中的客户端。例如，每架需要云端数据处理的无人机都充当客户端，并将其请求打包为事务。当客户端 C 想要处理一个消息时，它会向shim的当前视图 v 的主节点 P2 发送消息 ⟨T⟩C 交易 T 。请注意， C 使用 DS 来签署此消息（请参阅图 3 第 1 行）。当客户端C收到来自验证者 V 的RESPONSE消息时，将 ⟨T⟩C 标记为已处理。由于 C 知道 V 是我们基础设施中的可信实体，因此它很容易接受响应（第 3 行）。

B. Shim Ordering B. 垫片订购

SERVERLESSBFT assigns each shim node (e.g. UAV) an identifier, 0,1,2,…,nR . Initially,the shim node with identifier 0 is designated as the primary P of the shim. On receiving a client request ⟨T⟩C,P checks if ⟨T⟩C is well-formed. If this is the case, P initiates the PBFT protocol as follows.
SERVERLESSBFT 为每个 shim 节点（例如 UAV）分配一个标识符 0,1,2,…,nR 。最初，标识符为 0 的垫片节点被指定为垫片的主 P 。收到客户端请求后， ⟨T⟩C,P 检查 ⟨T⟩C 的格式是否正确。如果是这种情况，P 如下发起 PBFT 协议。
  • Pre-prepare. The primary P assigns a sequence number k to the well-formed client message m:=⟨T⟩C and sends it as a PREPREPARE message to all the nodes of the shim. This PREPREPARE message also includes a digest Δ=H(m) , which is used in future communication to save space. Notice that the primary signs this message using MAC, which provide sufficient guarantees for this phase. When a node R∈R receives a PREPREPARE message from the primary P of view v ,it runs the message through a series of checks. If the checks are successful,then R agrees to support the order k for this client request by broadcasting a PREPARE message.
    预先准备。主 P 将序列号 k 分配给格式正确的客户端消息 m:=⟨T⟩C ，并将其作为 PREPREPARE 消息发送到 shim 的所有节点。此 PREPREPARE 消息还包含一个摘要 Δ=H(m) ，用于将来的通信以节省空间。请注意，主节点使用 MAC 签署此消息，这为此阶段提供了足够的保证。当节点 R∈R 从视图 v 的主 P 接收到 PREPREPARE 消息时，它会通过一系列检查来运行该消息。如果检查成功，则 R 同意通过广播 PREPARE 消息来支持此客户端请求的订单 k 。
  • Prepare. When a node R receives identical PREPARE messages from 2fR+1 distinct nodes (can include its own message to reach the count),it marks the request m as prepared and broadcasts a COMMIT message. We require each node R to use DS to sign the COMMIT message.
    准备。当节点 R 从 2fR+1 个不同节点接收到相同的 PREPARE 消息（可以包含自己的消息以达到计数）时，它将请求 m 标记为已准备好并广播 COMMIT 消息。我们要求每个节点 R 使用DS来签署COMMIT消息。
  • Commit. When R receives identical COMMIT messages from 2fR+1 nodes,it marks m as committed.
    犯罪。当R从 2fR+1 节点接收到相同的COMMIT消息时，它将 m 标记为已提交。
Remark. PBFT requires two phases of quadratic communi- cation complexity. Instead, shim can employ BFT protocols like POE [40] and SBFT [41] that guarantee linear commu- nication with the help of advanced cryptographic schemes like threshold signatures. Note: in our architecture, the edge devices are acting as both clients and shim nodes.
评论。 PBFT 需要二次通信复杂度的两个阶段。相反，shim 可以采用 POE [40] 和 SBFT [41] 等 BFT 协议，借助门限签名等高级加密方案来保证线性通信。注意：在我们的架构中，边缘设备既充当客户端又充当填充节点。

C. Serverless Optimistic Execution
C. 无服务器乐观执行

Once P commits a request, SERVERLESSBFT requires P to connect with the serverless cloud and spawn nE executors. P sends each of these executors an EXECUTE message (Line 9), which includes a certificate C ; a set of signatures of 2fR+1 distinct shim nodes and proves that these nodes agreed to order this request (Line 8). Prior to executing the transaction T ,each executor E∈E checks if the certificate C is valid.
一旦 P 提交请求，SERVERLESSBFT 就会要求 P 连接到无服务器云并生成 nE 执行器。 P 向每个执行器发送一条 EXECUTE 消息（第 9 行），其中包含证书 C ；一组 2fR+1 不同 shim 节点的签名，并证明这些节点同意订购此请求（第 8 行）。在执行交易 T 之前，每个执行者 E∈E 检查证书 C 是否有效。
During execution, E may need to access the value of read- write sets (rw). Hence,it connects with the storage S and fetches the required data (Lines 17-18). However, executors do not write to the storage. Any intermediate results are stored locally. Further, these executors do not communicate with each other. Post execution, each executor E sends a VERIFY message to the verifier V ,which includes the computed result r ,certificate C ,and accessed read-write sets rw.
在执行过程中，E可能需要访问读写集（rw）的值。因此，它与存储 S 连接并获取所需的数据（第 17-18 行）。但是，执行程序不会写入存储。任何中间结果都存储在本地。此外，这些执行者彼此之间不进行通信。执行后，每个执行器 E 向验证器 V 发送 VERIFY 消息，其中包括计算结果 r 、证书 C 以及访问的读写集 rw 。
Remark. We allow shim to spawn either stateless or stateful executors [38], [42]. Stateful executors have memory and remember the results of last execution. By definition, severless executors are "fleeting" and return after execution; a common way to assign these executors memory is by having a layer that stores computed results [14]. To employ stateful executors in our model, we would need BFT guarantees on the additional layer. Hence,we focus on stateless executors. Including C in the EXECUTE and VERIFY messages helps to detect byzantine attacks (& VI-B). Further, by employing threshold signatures, we can reduce the size of the certificate. Threshold signatures allow combining 2fR+1 signatures into a single signature.
评论。我们允许 shim 生成无状态或有状态的执行器 [38]、[42]。有状态执行器有记忆并记住上次执行的结果。根据定义，无服务器执行器是“短暂的”，执行后返回；分配这些执行器内存的常见方法是使用一个存储计算结果的层[14]。为了在我们的模型中使用有状态执行器，我们需要在附加层上提供拜占庭容错 (BFT) 保证。因此，我们关注无状态执行者。在 EXECUTE 和 VERIFY 消息中包含 C 有助于检测拜占庭攻击（&VI-B）。此外，通过采用门限签名，我们可以减小证书的大小。阈值签名允许将 2fR+1 签名合并为单个签名。

D. Verifier and Concurrency Control
D. 验证者和并发控制

The verifier V is a lightweight wrapper around the data- store S and is assumed to be correct and trusted. The verifier collects well-formed VERIFY messages from the executors (in set V ) and once it has a quorum of matching results that do not violate the concurrency control constraints, it updates the data-store. It performs these tasks in the following order:
验证器 V 是数据存储 S 的轻量级包装器，并且被假定是正确且可信的。验证程序从执行程序（在集合 V 中）收集格式正确的 VERIFY 消息，一旦它拥有不违反并发控制约束的匹配结果的法定数量，它就会更新数据存储。它按以下顺序执行这些任务：
1) If set V has at least fE+1 matching VERIFY messages, V marks the transaction as matched. Following this, V ignores any other VERIFY message for ⟨T⟩C (Line 23).
1) 如果集合 V 至少有 fE+1 条匹配的 VERIFY 消息，则 V 将事务标记为匹配。此后， V 会忽略 ⟨T⟩C 的任何其他 VERIFY 消息（第 23 行）。
2) If k is the sequence number for ⟨T⟩C and kmax is the sequence number of last validated request,then if kmax≠k , V places the k -th request in the list π (Line 29).
2) 如果 k 是 ⟨T⟩C 的序列号， kmax 是最后验证请求的序列号，则如果 kmax≠k ，< b4> 将第 k 个请求放入列表 π 中（第 29 行）。
3) If kmax=k,V checks if the value of the read-write sets rw of the k -th request is same as that in the data-store S (Lines 31-32). If the read sets match, V sends the client and the shim primary RESPONSE messages and updates the write
3) 如果 kmax=k,V 检查第 k 次请求的读写集rw的值是否与数据存储 S 中的值相同（第 31-32 行）。如果读取集匹配， V 发送客户端和垫片主要响应消息并更新写入
2 Some BFT protocols require a client request to be sent to all the nodes.
2 某些 BFT 协议要求将客户端请求发送到所有节点。
sets at the storage in accordance with the result r (Lines 33- 34). Note: matching read-write sets is only required when the transactions are conflicting. We discuss this in Section VI.
根据结果​​ r 设置存储（第 33-34 行）。注意：只有当事务冲突时才需要匹配读写集。我们将在第六节讨论这一点。
4) Next, V increments kmax and checks if π includes the transaction with sequence number kmax . If so,it removes the kmax -th transaction from π and runs steps in Lines 26-27.
4) 接下来， V 递增 kmax 并检查 π 是否包含序列号为 kmax 的交易。如果是，它将从 π 中删除第 kmax 事务并运行第 26-27 行中的步骤。
These concurrency control checks ensure that consistent updates are written to the storage.
这些并发控制检查可确保将一致的更新写入存储。

E. System Guarantees 五、制度保障

We now state the guarantees offered by our different com- ponents of our serverless-edge architecture.
我们现在阐述无服务器边缘架构的不同组件提供的保证。
Shim Consistency. If an honest node commits a transaction T ,then all the honest nodes commit T .
垫片一致性。如果一个诚实节点提交了一笔交易 T ，那么所有诚实节点都会提交 T 。
Shim Non-Divergence. If two honest nodes order a transac- tion T at sequence number k and k′ ,then k=k′ .
垫片不发散。如果两个诚实节点在序列号 k 和 k′ 处订购交易 T ，则为 k=k′ 。
Shim Termination. If an honest client sends a transaction T , then an honest node will eventually commit T .
垫片终止。如果诚实的客户端发送交易 T ，那么诚实的节点最终将提交 T 。
Executor Termination. If an honest primary sends an EXECUTE message for transaction T ,then an honest executor will execute T .
执行者终止。如果诚实的主节点发送事务 T 的 EXECUTE 消息，那么诚实的执行器将执行 T 。
Verifier Non-Divergence. If the shim commits a transaction T at sequence k ,then the verifier will eventually update the corresponding result at the storage at order k .
验证者无分歧。如果垫片在序列 k 处提交事务 T ，那么验证者最终将在存储中按顺序更新相应的结果 k 。
Together, shim consistency, shim non-divergence, and veri- fier non-divergence imply safety, while shim termination and executor termination imply liveness. Our SERVERLESSBFT protocol guarantees safety in an asynchronous environment where the messages can get lost, delayed, or duplicated, and byzantine components can collude or act arbitrarily. To guaran- tee liveness, our SERVERLESSBFT protocol expects periods of synchrony. Note: our SERVERLESSBFT offers standard safety and liveness guarantees, also offered by other systems [16], [40], [17], [18], [19].
垫片一致性、垫片不发散和验证者不发散一起意味着安全性，而垫片终止和执行器终止意味着活跃性。我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议保证了异步环境中的安全性，在异步环境中，消息可能会丢失、延迟或重复，并且拜占庭组件可能会串通或任意行事。为了保证活跃性，我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议需要同步周期。注意：我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 提供标准的安全性和活跃性保证，其他系统也提供[16]、[40]、[17]、[18]、[19]。

V. TACKLING BYZANTINE ATTACKS
五、应对拜占庭式攻击

In our architecture,at most fR shim nodes and fE serverless executors can act byzantine. If the primary of shim is honest, then byzantine nodes cannot affect the ongoing transactional flow. Similarly, byzantine executors can either provide incor- rect result or ignore execution,but as there are at least fE+1 honest executors, EXECUTE messages sent by honest primaries will be processed. Hence, following is an exhaustive list of attacks on our design.
在我们的架构中，最多 fR 个 shim 节点和 fE 个无服务器执行器可以拜占庭行为。如果 shim 的主节点是诚实的，那么拜占庭节点就不会影响正在进行的交易流。类似地，拜占庭执行器可以提供不正确的结果或忽略执行，但由于至少有 fE+1 个诚实的执行器，因此将处理由诚实的主程序发送的 EXECUTE 消息。因此，以下是对我们设计的攻击的详尽列表。
(i) Request Suppression. If the primary of shim is byzantine, it can try to prevent consensus on some client requests.
(i) 请求抑制。如果 shim 的主要部分是拜占庭式的，它可以尝试阻止对某些客户端请求达成共识。
(ii) Nodes in Dark. If shim's primary is byzantine, it can keep up to fR honest shim nodes in dark by not involving them in consensuses.
(ii) 黑暗中的节点。如果 shim 的主节点是拜占庭式的，则它可以通过不让 fR 个诚实的 shim 节点参与共识来将它们保持在黑暗中。
(iii) Verifier Flooding. Byzantine components can flood the verifier with requests that have been already verified.
(iii) 验证者洪泛。拜占庭组件可以用已经验证的请求淹没验证者。
Next, we present algorithms to recover from these attacks.
接下来，我们提出从这些攻击中恢复的算法。

A. Request Suppression A. 请求抑制

In the serverless-edge architecture, byzantine components can work together to deny service to one or more clients. This request suppression attack can take three different forms:
在无服务器边缘架构中，拜占庭组件可以协同工作，拒绝向一个或多个客户端提供服务。这种请求抑制攻击可以采取三种不同的形式：

Fig. 3. Byzantine Fault-Tolerant transaction processing by SERVERLESSBFT protocol in the serverless-edge architecture.
图 3. 无服务器边缘架构中通过 SERVERLESSBFT 协议进行拜占庭容错事务处理。
(i) Request Ignorance. If the shim's primary node P is byzantine,it can willfully drop a request m from a client C , or indefinitely delay consensus on m .
(i) 请求不知情。如果 shim 的主节点 P 是拜占庭的，它可以故意丢弃来自客户端 C 的请求 m ，或者无限期延迟 m .
(ii) Unsuccessful Consensus. A byzantine primary P may involve less than 2fR+1 nodes in consensus on a client request
(ii) 不成功的共识。拜占庭主 P 可能涉及少于 2fR+1 个节点来就客户端请求达成共识

Fig. 4. Actions performed by various participants of the serverless-edge infrastructure in response to a request suppression attack.
图 4. 无服务器边缘基础设施的各个参与者响应请求抑制攻击而执行的操作。

(iii) Less Executors. A byzantine primary P may permit consensus on a client request m ,but disallow its execution by spawning less than nE serverless executors. In such a case, the verifier V will not receive fE+1 matching execution results.
(iii) 减少执行人。拜占庭主 P 可能允许对客户端请求 m 达成共识，但通过生成少于 nE 个无服务器执行器来禁止其执行。在这种情况下，验证者 V 将不会收到 fE+1 匹配的执行结果。
To detect these attacks, we setup three distinct timers at various components of our architecture.
为了检测这些攻击，我们在架构的各个组件上设置了三个不同的计时器。
  • Client timer: Our SERVERLESSBFT protocol requires each client C to start a timer τm prior to sending its request m to the primary P. When C receives a RESPONSE message for m from the verifier V ,it stops τm .
    客户端计时器：我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议要求每个客户端 C 在将其请求 m 发送到主 P 之前启动计时器 τm 。当 C 收到 RESPONSE 消息时对于来自验证者 V 的 m ，它会停止 τm 。
  • Node timer. Our SERVERLESSBFT protocol requires each node R∈R to start a timer τm when it receives a well-formed PREPREPARE message for a client request m from the primary P. When R marks m as committed,it stops τm .
    节点定时器。我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议要求每个节点 R∈R 在从主 P 接收到针对客户端请求 m 的格式良好的 PREPREPARE 消息时启动计时器 τm 。 R 将 m 标记为已提交，它会停止 τm 。
  • Node re-transmission timer. If a non-primary node R∈R receives an ERROR message from the verifier V (see Sec- tion V-A2) then R forwards the ERROR message to the primary P and starts the re-transmission timer Υ . When R receives a corresponding ACK message from V ,it stops Υ .
    节点重传定时器。如果非主节点 R∈R 从验证者 V 接收到错误消息（参见第V-A2节），则 R 将错误消息转发到验证者 V （参见第V-A2节）主 P 并启动重传计时器 Υ 。当 R 收到来自 V 的相应ACK消息时，停止 Υ 。
In the case the timers of C or R expire,the respective component detects a request suspension attack and initiates the following mechanisms for recovery from this attack.
在 C 或 R 定时器到期的情况下，相应组件检测到请求挂起攻击并启动以下机制以从该攻击中恢复。
1) Client action on timeout: If a client C’s timer τm timeouts,then C forwards its request to the verifier V and restarts its timer (refer to Figure 4). In specific, each time C's timer expires, after some exponential backoff, it re-sends its request to V until it receives a RESPONSE message from V .
1）客户端超时动作：如果客户端C的计时器 τm 超时，则 C 将其请求转发给验证者 V 并重新启动其计时器（参见图4）。具体来说，每次 C 的计时器到期时，经过一些指数退避后，它都会重新向 V 发送请求，直到收到来自 V 的 RESPONSE 消息。
2) Verifier action on receiving client request: When the verifier V receives a request m:=⟨T⟩c from client C ,it first determines if it has seen ⟨T⟩C till now or not. If V has not received any VERIFY messages for ⟨T⟩c ,it sends ⟨ERROR(⟨T⟩c)⟩V message to all the nodes in the shim. Oth- erwise, there can be only three cases:
2) 验证者接收客户端请求时的动作：当验证者 V 从客户端 C 接收到请求 m:=⟨T⟩c 时，它首先确定是否已经看到 ⟨T⟩C 尚未收到 ⟨T⟩c 的任何 VERIFY 消息，它将向 shim 中的所有节点发送 ⟨ERROR(⟨T⟩c)⟩V 消息。否则，只能出现三种情况：
(i) V did send a RESPONSE message for ⟨T⟩C ,so it simply resends the RESPONSE message.
(i) V 确实为 ⟨T⟩C 发送了 RESPONSE 消息，因此它只是重新发送 RESPONSE 消息。
(ii) ⟨T⟩C resides in π . Further,assume that it was ordered by shim at some sequence number k . So kmax<k ,and V is waiting for the request with sequence number kmax . Unless the kmax -th request is validated by V ,succeeding requests cannot be processed. So, V needs to notify shim nodes about the missing request at sequence kmax ,and it does so by sending ⟨ERROR(kmax)⟩⟩V to all the shim nodes. Note: this gap between kmax and k could have been created by byzantine primary.
(ii) ⟨T⟩C 位于 π 中。此外，假设它是由垫片按某个序列号 k 排序的。因此 kmax<k 和 V 正在等待序列号为 kmax 的请求。除非第 kmax 请求经过 V 验证，否则无法处理后续请求。因此， V 需要通知 shim 节点在序列 kmax 处丢失的请求，并且它通过向所有 shim 节点发送 ⟨ERROR(kmax)⟩⟩V 来实现这一点。注意： kmax 和 k 之间的间隙可能是由拜占庭初选造成的。
(iii) V did not receive fE+1 matching VERIFY messages for ⟨T⟩C . This can only occur if the primary is byzantine. So, V sends ⟨RepLACE(⟨T⟩C)⟩V to all the shim nodes.
(iii) V 没有收到 fE+1 与 ⟨T⟩C 匹配的 VERIFY 消息。仅当主节点是拜占庭式的时才会发生这种情况。因此， V 将 ⟨RepLACE(⟨T⟩C)⟩V 发送到所有 shim 节点。
Once V successfully verifies the request at sequence number kmax or ⟨T⟩C,V creates a corresponding ⟨ACK(kmax)⟩V or ⟨ACK(⟨T⟩C)⟩V message and broadcasts it to shim.
一旦 V 成功验证了序列号 kmax 或 ⟨T⟩C,V 处的请求，就会创建相应的 ⟨ACK(kmax)⟩V 或 ⟨ACK(⟨T⟩C)⟩V 消息，并且将其广播到垫片。
3) Node action on ERROR message: When a shim node R∈R receives an ERROR message from the verifier,it can only conclude the following:
3）节点对ERROR消息的动作：当shim节点 R∈R 收到来自验证者的ERROR消息时，它只能得出以下结论：
  • R received ⟨ERROR(kmax)⟩⟩V message and has either com- mitted or not committed the request at sequence number kmax .
    R 收到 ⟨ERROR(kmax)⟩⟩V 消息，并且已提交或未提交序列号 kmax 处的请求。
  • R received ⟨Error(⟨T⟩C)⟩V message and has either committed or not committed the request ⟨T⟩C .
    R 收到 ⟨Error(⟨T⟩C)⟩V 消息，并且已提交或未提交请求 ⟨T⟩C 。
Irrespective of these cases,the node R starts a re-transmit timer Υ to track the behavior of the primary. Next,it forwards the received ERROR message to the primary. If the timer Υ expires before R receives a corresponding acknowledgment message (⟨ACK(kmax)⟩⟩Vor⟨ACK(⟨T⟩C)) from the verifier V,R concludes that the primary is byzantine and requests a view-change. Hence, the onus is on the primary to guarantee consensus and execution.
无论这些情况如何，节点 R 都会启动重传计时器 Υ 来跟踪主节点的行为。接下来，它将收到的 ERROR 消息转发给主节点。如果计时器 Υ 在 R 从验证者收到相应的确认消息 (⟨ACK(kmax)⟩⟩Vor⟨ACK(⟨T⟩C)) 之前到期， V,R 就得出主节点是拜占庭式的结论并请求观点改变。因此，保证共识和执行的首要责任是。
4) Node action on timeout: When the timer τm for a node R∈R expires, R concludes that the shim’s primary for view v is byzantine,and it requests primary replacement by broadcasting a VIEWCHANGE message. We employ PBFT's view-change protocol to replace a byzantine primary. A node R’s request for change of view from v to v+1 is only successful if it receives support of at least 2fR+1 nodes,that is,at least 2fR+1 shim nodes must broadcast VIEWCHANGE messages. Replacing the current primary requires designating another shim node as the next primary. Like PBFT, we assume nodes have a pre-decided order of becoming the primary. As a result, when the replica designated as the primary for view v+1 receives VIEWCHANGE requests from at least 2fR+1 nodes, it assumes the role of the primary and broadcasts a NEWVIEW message to bring all the nodes to the same state. Similarly, when a node R receives a REPLACE message from the verifier V ,it initiates the view-change protocol to replace the primary P to view v . We defer the details for the exact view-change protocol to the original PBFT paper [16].
4) 超时时的节点操作：当节点 R∈R 的计时器 τm 到期时， R 断定该垫片是视图 v 的主节点是拜占庭式的，它通过广播 VIEWCHANGE 消息来请求主替换。我们采用 PBFT 的视图更改协议来取代拜占庭主协议。节点 R 将视图从 v 更改为 v+1 的请求只有在收到至少 2fR+1 个节点（即至少 shim 节点必须广播 VIEWCHANGE 消息。替换当前主节点需要指定另一个填充节点作为下一个主节点。与 PBFT 一样，我们假设节点有一个预先决定的成为主节点的顺序。因此，当指定为视图 v+1 主节点的副本从至少 2fR+1 节点接收到 VIEWCHANGE 请求时，它会承担主节点的角色并广播 NEWVIEW 消息以将所有节点处于相同状态。类似地，当节点 R 收到来自验证者 V 的 REPLACE 消息时，它会启动视图更改协议，将主 P 替换为视图 v 。我们将确切的视图更改协议的细节推迟到原始 PBFT 论文 [16]。

B. Shim Nodes in Dark
B. 黑暗中的匀场节点

If the primary P is byzantine,it may attempt to only include 2fR+1 nodes in consensus as only 2fR+1 nodes are needed to mark any request as prepared and committed. As a result,
如果主 P 是拜占庭式的，它可能会尝试仅在共识中包含 2fR+1 节点，因为只需要 2fR+1 节点将任何请求标记为已准备好和已提交。因此，
the remaining fR nodes will be in dark. Next,we explain what we mean by being in dark.
其余的 fR 节点将处于黑暗状态。接下来，我们解释一下“处于黑暗中”的含义。
(i) Node Exclusion. A byzantine primary P can exclude up to fR honest nodes from consensuses by not sending them the PREPREPARE messages for client requests.
(i) 节点排除。拜占庭主 P 可以通过不向客户端请求发送 PREPREPARE 消息来从共识中排除最多 fR 个诚实节点。
(ii) Equivocation. A byzantine primary P can equivocate by associating two client requests with the same sequence number k . If P is clever,it will ensure that one of these client requests is committed by at least fR+1 honest nodes while the remaining fR honest nodes do not commit any request at sequence number k .
(ii) 含糊其辞。拜占庭主 P 可以通过将两个客户端请求与相同的序列号 k 关联来进行模棱两可。如果 P 很聪明，它将确保这些客户端请求之一由至少 fR+1 个诚实节点提交，而其余 fR 个诚实节点不提交任何请求请求序列号 k 。
The key challenge to resolving the attack (i) is that it is impossible to detect. In this attack, the byzantine primary P is clever and does not want to risk replacement. Hence, P facilitates continuous consensus on incoming client requests by at least fR+1 honest nodes. As a result,the remaining fR nodes are unable to trigger view-change by themselves.
解决攻击 (i) 的关键挑战是无法检测到。在这次攻击中，拜占庭主P很聪明，不想冒替换的风险。因此，P 有助于至少 fR+1 个诚实节点对传入的客户端请求达成持续共识。因此，剩余的 fR 节点无法自行触发视图更改。
Lemma V.1. If at most fR shim nodes are in dark,then it is impossible to detect such an attack and replace the primary.
引理V.1。如果最多 fR 个 shim 节点处于黑暗状态，则不可能检测到此类攻击并更换主节点。
Proof. Let D be the set of shim nodes in dark,such that |D|≤fR . We start with the assumption that the nodes in D are able to prove that they are under an attack by the byzantine primary P and ensure P ’s replacement by convincing a majority of nodes to participate in the view-change protocol.
证明。令 D 为黑暗中的垫片节点集合，使得 |D|≤fR 。我们首先假设 D 中的节点能够证明它们受到拜占庭主节点 P 的攻击，并确保 P 被替换为说服大多数节点参与视图更改协议。
For a view-change to take place at least 2fR+1 nodes need to support such an event. As P is clever,it ensures that at least U≥fR+1 honest nodes continuously participate in consensus. Clearly, U>D ,which implies that a majority of honest nodes will not request view-change. The remaining nR−U−D=fR nodes are byzantine and will support the primary in this attack. Moreover,the nodes in set U cannot distinguish between the nodes in set D and the up to fR actual byzantine nodes, as the byzantine nodes can always request a view-change in an attempt to derail the system progress by replacing an honest primary. Hence, the view-change request by nodes in D will never be successful.
要发生视图更改，至少 2fR+1 个节点需要支持此类事件。由于 P 很聪明，它确保至少有 U≥fR+1 个诚实节点持续参与共识。显然， U>D ，这意味着大多数诚实节点不会请求视图更改。其余的 nR−U−D=fR 节点是拜占庭节点，将支持本次攻击中的主节点。此外，集合 U 中的节点无法区分集合 D 中的节点和最多 fR 个实际拜占庭节点，因为拜占庭节点总是可以请求一个view-change 试图通过替换诚实的主节点来破坏系统进程。因此， D 中的节点的视图更改请求永远不会成功。
Featherweight Checkpoints. To recover from nodes in dark attacks, we design a featherweight variant of existing check- point protocols [16], [43]. Existing BFT protocols require nodes to periodically construct and exchange CHECKPOINT messages, but these messages are expensive as they include all the client requests and the proof that they are committed (COMMIT messages from 2fR+1 distinct nodes) since the last checkpoint. As our shim nodes neither execute client requests nor store any data, during our featherweight checkpoint proto- col, these nodes only send the signed proofs (certificates) for each committed request since last checkpoint.
羽量级检查站。为了从黑暗攻击中的节点中恢复，我们设计了现有检查点协议的轻量级变体[16]，[43]。现有的 BFT 协议要求节点定期构建和交换 CHECKPOINT 消息，但这些消息非常昂贵，因为它们包含自上一个检查点以来的所有客户端请求以及它们已提交的证据（来自 2fR+1 不同节点的 COMMIT 消息） 。由于我们的 shim 节点既不执行客户端请求也不存储任何数据，因此在我们的轻量级检查点协议期间，这些节点仅发送自上次检查点以来每个提交的请求的签名证明（证书）。
Remark. The nodes in dark attacks do not make the system unsafe but put it at the mercy of the byzantine nodes, which can stop responding after several consensuses have passed; the system suffers from massive communication during recovery.
评论。处于黑暗攻击中的节点不会使系统变得不安全，而是将其置于拜占庭节点的摆布之下，拜占庭节点可以在几次共识通过后停止响应；系统在恢复期间会遭受大量通信的影响。

C. Verifier Flooding C. 验证者洪泛

As the verifier manages all updates to the data-store, it is a desirable target by byzantine components. Specifically, byzantine components can try the following ways to disrupt the system by flooding the verifier with redundant requests.
由于验证者管理数据存储的所有更新，因此它是拜占庭组件的理想目标。具体来说，拜占庭组件可以尝试以下方法，通过向验证者发送大量冗余请求来破坏系统。
(i) Duplicate Spawning by Primary. If the shim's primary node is byzantine, it can spawn more executors than necessary.
(i) 主要重复生成。如果 shim 的主节点是拜占庭式的，它可能会产生不必要的执行器。
(ii) Duplicate Spawning by Non-primary. A byzantine non- primary node that was once the primary node of shim has access to old certificates and EXECUTE messages. It can use these messages to spawn new executors at the serverless cloud.
(ii) 非主要的重复生成。曾经是 shim 主节点的拜占庭非主节点可以访问旧证书和 EXECUTE 消息。它可以使用这些消息在无服务器云中生成新的执行程序。
(iii) Duplicate Messages by Executors. A byzantine execu- tor can send duplicate VERIFY messages to the verifier.
(iii) 执行者重复消息。拜占庭执行者可以向验证者发送重复的 VERIFY 消息。
Although flooding attacks seem trivial to perform, they have monetary impacts on the byzantine components. Spawning each serverless executor requires the spawner to pay a fixed amount of money. As a result, any flooding attack performed by a byzantine component will be self-penalizing. For exam- ple, in our architecture, each primary is paid a fixed amount per consensus by the edge application organization. Hence, a rational byzantine component will avoid this attack.
尽管洪水攻击执行起来似乎微不足道，但它们对拜占庭组件产生了金钱影响。生成每个无服务器执行器需要生成器支付固定金额。因此，拜占庭组件执行的任何洪水攻击都将是自我惩罚。例如，在我们的架构中，边缘应用程序组织根据共识向每个主节点支付固定金额。因此，理性的拜占庭组件将避免这种攻击。
Moreover, all of these attacks are trying to flood the verifier with the VERIFY messages. To mitigate the impact of these flooding attacks: we require the verifier V to ignore any VERIFY message for a client request m ,once it has received matching VERIFY messages for m from fE+1 executors. Finally, it is a common practice to connect different entities on the network via sockets. If flooding attacks take place, the verifier can block communication from such connections.
此外，所有这些攻击都试图用 VERIFY 消息淹没验证者。为了减轻这些洪水攻击的影响：我们要求验证者 V 在收到 m 的匹配 VERIFY 消息后忽略客户端请求 m 的任何 VERIFY 消息b2> 来自 fE+1 执行者。最后，通过套接字连接网络上的不同实体是一种常见的做法。如果发生洪泛攻击，验证者可以阻止来自此类连接的通信。

VI. TRANSACTIONAL CONFLICTS
六．交易冲突

Two client transactions T and T′ are termed as conflicting if T and T′ require access to a common data-item x and at least one of these operations writes to x [44]. In our SERVERLESSBFT protocol, transactional conflicts arise from the following set of transactions: two transactions T and T′ ordered at sequences k and k′ ,respectively,and k<k′ and T writes to x ,which T′ reads.
如果 T 和 T′ 需要访问公共数据项 x 和 T′ 被称为冲突。 /b4> 并且这些操作中至少有一个写入 x [44]。在我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议中，事务冲突由以下一组事务引起：按序列 k 和 k′ 排序的两个事务 T 和 T′ ，分别将 k<k′ 和 T 写入 x ，由 T′ 读取。
Example VI.1. For ensuing discussions, we assume two conflicting transactions T and T′ . Let the sequence number for T be 3 and sequence number for T′ be 4 . Further,assume T needs to write to data-item x and T′ needs to read x .
实施例VI.1。为了接下来的讨论，我们假设有两个冲突的事务 T 和 T′ 。令 T 的序列号为 3 ， T′ 的序列号为 4 。此外，假设 T 需要写入数据项 x 并且 T′ 需要读取 x 。

A. Concurrent Spawning A. 并发生成

On a close inspection of Figure 3, one can observe that the primary P does not wait for consensus of the k -th request to finish before initiating consensus for the (k+1) -th request. This process of concurrently invoking multiple consensuses has been employed by prior works to increase the system throughput as it reduces the idle times for nodes [17], [45].
仔细检查图 3，可以发现主 P 在启动 (k+1) 的共识之前不会等待第 k 请求的共识完成。 b2> 第一个请求。先前的工作已采用这种同时调用多个共识的过程来提高系统吞吐量，因为它减少了节点的空闲时间[17]，[45]。
To further boost the throughput, we permit the primary to spawn the nE executors for the (k+1) -th request prior to spawning executors for k -th request. We term this as concurrent spawning. If the client requests are non-conflicting, concurrent spawning helps to parallelize execution.
为了进一步提高吞吐量，我们允许主节点在为 k 请求生成执行器之前为第 (k+1) 请求生成 nE 执行器。我们将其称为并发生成。如果客户端请求不冲突，并发生成有助于并行执行。
In the case transactions are conflicting,like T and T′ of Example VI.1, we can have two cases: the read-write sets a transaction accesses are either known or unknown to the shim nodes prior to execution. Depending on the knowledge
在事务发生冲突的情况下，如例 VI.1 中的 T 和 T′ ，我们可以有两种情况：事务访问的读写集对于事务来说是已知的或未知的。在执行之前填充节点。取决于知识
of read-write sets, transactions may or may not abort in our architecture. A naive way would be to ask the shim primary to sequentially spawn executors for each client request, but that will significantly reduce the throughput attained by our SERVERLESSBFT protocol. Hence, we design algorithms to handle either cases, which we discuss next.
对于读写集，事务在我们的架构中可能会也可能不会中止。一种简单的方法是要求 shim 主节点为每个客户端请求顺序生成执行器，但这将显着降低我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议获得的吞吐量。因此，我们设计算法来处理这两种情况，我们将在接下来讨论。

B. Unknown Read-Write Sets
B. 未知的读写集

If the shim nodes cannot determine the read-write sets of a transaction during consensus, we require the shim nodes to continue following the algorithm in Figure 3. The only change is that the shim's primary should spawn an additional fE executors; the shim primary now spawns nE≥3fE+1 executors instead of nE≥2fE+1 as stated earlier. We prove the need for these additional executors later.
如果 shim 节点在共识期间无法确定事务的读写集，我们要求 shim 节点继续遵循图 3 中的算法。唯一的变化是 shim 的主节点应该生成一个额外的 fE 执行人； shim 主现在生成 nE≥3fE+1 执行器，而不是前面所述的 nE≥2fE+1 。我们稍后证明需要这些额外的执行器。
However,due to the conflicting transactions like T and T′ of Example VI.1,the verifier V may observe the following: (i) it did not receive fE+1 matching VERIFY messages for T′ , or (ii) the read sets of T′ are stale. In such cases,the verifier would have to abort transaction T′ .
然而，由于示例VI.1中的 T 和 T′ 等冲突事务，验证者 V 可能会观察到以下情况：（i）它没有收到 fE+1 匹配 T′ 的 VERIFY 消息，或者 (ii) T′ 的读取集已过时。在这种情况下，验证者将不得不中止交易 T′ 。
Byzantine Aborts and Decentralized Spawning. A big chal- lenge to permitting the verifier to abort transactions is a byzan- tine primary that can intentionally delay spawning executors for some of the committed transactions to get them aborted. Moreover, this attack is impossible to detect by other shim nodes or the verifier. Prior works have shown that there are no easy solutions to prevent byzantine aborts for conflicting transactions with unknown read-write sets [46]. One way to prevent this attack in our serverless-edge architecture is to require each node of the shim to spawn some executors at the serverless cloud. In specific,once a node R∈R commits a client request m ,it spawns e executors.
拜占庭式的中止和分散的生成。允许验证者中止交易的一个大挑战是拜占庭主节点，它可以故意延迟某些已提交交易的生成执行器以使其中止。而且，这种攻击不可能被其他 shim 节点或验证者检测到。先前的工作表明，没有简单的解决方案来防止具有未知读写集的冲突事务的拜占庭中止[46]。在我们的无服务器边缘架构中防止这种攻击的一种方法是要求 shim 的每个节点在无服务器云中生成一些执行程序。具体来说，一旦节点 R∈R 提交客户端请求 m ，它就会产生e执行器。
e={1, if nE≤nR⌈nE2fR+1⌉, otherwise 
(1)
If nE is less than nR ,then each node R∈R needs to spawn only one executor. This will guarantee that of all the spawned executors at least fE+1 are honest. Otherwise,each node R needs to spawn ⌈nE2fR+1⌉ executors. Why? Because up to fR nodes are byzantine and may avoid spawning any executors. Hence,the remaining 2fR+1 honest nodes need to spawn nE executors. Clearly,the total number of spawned executors (e× nR ) is much larger than the required number of executors nE . This is a trade-off we need to pay if we want to decentralize the spawning of serverless executors. Another major trade-off of this decentralized spawning is that if the read-write sets are known, then each node needs to sequentially spawn executors. Hence, like primary (refer to Section VI-C), each node has to track the dependencies. Moreover,the proposed value of e is only valid if each honest node commits the client request. If up to fR honest nodes are in dark,then e changes as follows:
如果 nE 小于 nR ，则每个节点 R∈R 只需要生成一个执行器。这将保证所有生成的执行器中至少 fE+1 是诚实的。否则，每个节点 R 需要生成 ⌈nE2fR+1⌉ 执行器。为什么？因为最多 fR 个节点是拜占庭式的，并且可以避免生成任何执行器。因此，剩余的 2fR+1 诚实节点需要生成 nE 执行器。显然，生成的执行器总数 (e× nR ）远大于所需的执行器 nE 数量。如果我们想要分散无服务器执行器的生成，这是我们需要付出的权衡。这种去中心化生成的另一个主要权衡是，如果读写集已知，那么每个节点都需要顺序生成执行器。因此，与主节点（参见第 VI-C 节）一样，每个节点都必须跟踪依赖关系。此外，仅当每个诚实节点提交客户端请求时， e 的建议值才有效。如果最多 fR 个诚实节点处于黑暗状态，则 e 变化如下：
e={1, if nE≤nR⌈nEfR+1⌉, otherwise 
(2)
Conservatively,we can set e=nE ,but that will lead to spawning nE×nR executors in the worst case.
保守地，我们可以设置 e=nE ，但这将导致在最坏的情况下产生 nE×nR 执行器。
Verifier Abort Detection. With the addition of byzantine aborts, the verifier needs to determine when to abort a trans- action T′ and if possible,the cause for abort. As a result,the verifier needs to wait for fE+1 matching VERIFY messages for T′ . For this purpose,our SERVERLESSBFT protocol requires the verifier V to start a timer τm when it receives the first VERIFY message for the transaction m:=T′ . V stops τm when it receives fE+1 matching VERIFY messages,or it receives VERIFY messages from all the 3fE+1 executors.
验证器中止检测。通过添加拜占庭中止，验证者需要确定何时中止事务 T′ ，以及如果可能的话，确定中止的原因。因此，验证者需要等待 fE+1 匹配 T′ 的 VERIFY 消息。为此，我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议要求验证者 V 在收到交易 m:=T′ 的第一条 VERIFY 消息时启动计时器 τm 。 V 在收到 fE+1 匹配的VERIFY消息时停止 τm ，或者收到来自所有 3fE+1 执行器的VERIFY消息。
Like in Figure 3, say the verifier collects all the incoming VERIFY messages for m in a set V . If the verifier’s timer expires while waiting, it takes one of the following actions:
如图 3 所示，假设验证者收集 V 集合中 m 的所有传入 VERIFY 消息。如果验证者的计时器在等待期间到期，它将采取以下操作之一：
  • |V|<2fE+1 : This case implies that the verifier V received less than 2fE+1 VERIFY messages for transaction T′ . As a result, V concludes that the primary P is byzantine and it creates and broadcasts a REPLACE message to the shim nodes. Receiving less than 2fE+1 VERIFY messages implies that either the primary P spawned less than nE executors or some messages got dropped; at most fE executors can act byzantine and can decide to not send VERIFY messages to V , In either case, it is safe to conservatively blame the primary. Note: even existing BFT protocols decide to blame the primary if messages get dropped [16], [41], [43].
    |V|<2fE+1 ：这种情况意味着验证者 V 收到的交易 T′ 验证消息少于 2fE+1 VERIFY 消息。因此， V 得出结论，主 P 是拜占庭的，它创建 REPLACE 消息并将其广播到 shim 节点。接收少于 2fE+1 VERIFY 消息意味着主 P 生成的执行器少于 nE 执行器，或者某些消息被丢弃；最多 fE 执行者可以采取拜占庭行为，并且可以决定不向 V 发送 VERIFY 消息，无论哪种情况，保守地责怪主执行者都是安全的。注意：如果消息被丢弃，即使现有的 BFT 协议也会决定归咎于主协议 [16]、[41]、[43]。
  • nE>|V|≥2fE+1 : This case implies that the verifier V received more than 2fE+1 VERIFY messages for transaction T′ . As a result,the verifier V cannot conclude that the shim’s primary is byzantine as V has received VERIFY message from at least 2fE+1 distinct executors. Observing responses from at least 2fE+1 executors is a guarantee that at least fE+1 honest executors tried to execute T′ to the best of their ability. Hence, even if the shim's primary is byzantine and intentionally delays spawning executors for T′ ,there is no way that the verifier can prove this (due to concurrent spawning).
    nE>|V|≥2fE+1 ：这种情况意味着验证者 V 收到了多于事务 T′ 的 2fE+1 VERIFY 消息。因此，验证者 V 无法得出垫片的主节点是拜占庭式的结论，因为 V 已从至少 2fE+1 个不同的执行器接收到 VERIFY 消息。观察至少 2fE+1 个执行者的响应可以保证至少 fE+1 个诚实的执行者尝试尽最大努力执行 T′ 。因此，即使垫片的主要是拜占庭式的并且故意延迟 T′ 的生成执行器，验证者也无法证明这一点（由于并发生成）。
This forces the verifier to abort this transaction. Assume k is the sequence number for T′ . If kmax=k ,then V sends the client an ⟨ABORT(T′)⟩V message. Otherwise, V adds T′ to the list π ,but tags it as abort. Later,when T′ is extracted from the list π ,the verifier V aborts it.
这迫使验证者中止该交易。假设 k 是 T′ 的序列号。如果 kmax=k ，则 V 向客户端发送 ⟨ABORT(T′)⟩V 消息。否则， V 将 T′ 添加到列表 π 中，但将其标记为中止。稍后，当从列表 π 中提取 T′ 时，验证器 V 中止它。
We now describe the indistinguishable attack, which forces us to require primary to spawn nE≥3fE+1 .
我们现在描述无法区分的攻击，这迫使我们需要primary来生成 nE≥3fE+1 。
Theorem VI.2. If client transactions are conflicting and the primary P spawns nE<3fE+1 executors,then the SERVERLESSBFT protocol faces an indistinguishable attack.
定理VI.2。如果客户端事务发生冲突并且主 P 生成 nE<3fE+1 执行器，则 SERVERLESSBFT 协议将面临难以区分的攻击。
Proof. Assume that P spawns only 2fE+1 executors. We know that up to fE of these executors can act byzantine. As a result, for any client request,the verifier V may receive only fE+1 VERIFY messages. Further, due to transactional conflicts, these fE+1 VERIFY messages may not match. Eventually, V ’s timer will expire and it needs to take some action. V can decide to abort this transaction, but this would lead to a new problem- a byzantine primary P may never spawn more than fE+1 executors and up to fE of those executors may be byzantine. Hence, all subsequent conflicting transactions may abort.
证明。假设 P 仅生成 2fE+1 执行器。我们知道这些执行者中最多 fE 可以采取拜占庭行为。因此，对于任何客户端请求，验证者 V 可能仅接收 fE+1 VERIFY消息。此外，由于事务冲突，这些 fE+1 VERIFY 消息可能不匹配。最终， V 的计时器将到期，并且需要采取一些操作。 V 可以决定中止此事务，但这会导致一个新问题 - 拜占庭主 P 可能永远不会产生超过 fE+1 个执行者，最多 < b9> 这些执行者可能是拜占庭式的。因此，所有后续的冲突事务可能会中止。
Alternatively, V can blame the primary for receiving less than fE+1 matching VERIFY messages,but such a decision could be wrong as P may not be byzantine and the lack of sufficient matching messages could be a result of conflicts and byzantine executors.
或者， V 可以责备主节点收到少于 fE+1 匹配的 VERIFY 消息，但这样的决定可能是错误的，因为 P 可能不是拜占庭式的，并且缺乏足够的匹配消息可能会导致冲突和拜占庭执行者的结果。

C. Best Effort Conflict Avoidance
C. 尽力避免冲突

In database literature, several works have employed the concept of deterministic databases for efficient conflict res- olution [47], [48], [49]. In these databases, the order in which transactions are applied to the database is determined prior to its execution, which is only possible if the read-write sets of the transactions are known to the participating nodes.
在数据库文献中，一些作品采用了确定性数据库的概念来有效解决冲突[47]、[48]、[49]。在这些数据库中，事务应用于数据库的顺序是在其执行之前确定的，这只有在参与节点知道事务的读写集的情况下才有可能。
In our SERVERLESSBFT protocol, we learn from these databases. If the primary has any knowledge of the read- write sets, it uses the queuing strategy of these databases, to create plans that allow running non-conflicting transactions in parallel [47], [48], [50], [49], [51]. Such a strategy would require us to make straightforward modifications to the algo- rithm presented in Figure 3. We would need the shim primary to maintain a logical map of all data-items. This map does not store any values of the data-items, but helps the primary to locally lock different data-items. Further, the primary can no longer concurrently spawn executors for a transaction until it has determined its conflicts. Next, we list the steps.
在我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议中，我们从这些数据库中学习。如果主数据库了解读写集，它就会使用这些数据库的排队策略来创建允许并行运行非冲突事务的计划[47]、[48]、[50]、[49]、 [51]。这样的策略需要我们对图 3 中所示的算法进行直接修改。我们需要主要的垫片来维护所有数据项的逻辑映射。该映射不存储数据项的任何值，但帮助主节点在本地锁定不同的数据项。此外，主节点在确定其冲突之前不能再同时为事务生成执行程序。接下来，我们列出步骤。
1) The primary P adds the k′ -th transaction to the execution queue after it has added (or spawned executors for) all the k -th transactions in the queue,where k<k′ .
1) 主 P 在添加（或为其生成执行器）所有 k 事务后，将第 k′ 事务添加到执行队列中队列，其中 k<k′ 。
2) If the k′ -th transaction does not conflict with any k -th transaction (k<k′) ,P spawns serverless executors for the k′ - th transaction after it has logically locked all the data-items that are written by the k′ -th transaction.
2) 如果第 k′ 事务不与任何 k 事务 (k<k′) 冲突，P 为 k′ 生成无服务器执行器- 第一个事务在逻辑上锁定了第 k′ 个事务写入的所有数据项之后。
3) Next, P dequeues a non-conflicting transaction at the head of some queue and repeats Step 2.
3) 接下来，P 将某个队列头部的非冲突事务出队，并重复步骤 2。
4) When P is notified by the verifier V that T has been executed,it unlocks the data-items accessed by T and follows Step 3. We believe these steps can help to reduce aborts. VII. SAFETY AND LIVENESS GUARANTEES
4) 当验证者 V 通知 P 已执行 T 时，它会解锁 T 访问的数据项，并接下来是步骤 3。我们相信这些步骤有助于减少中止。七．安全和活力保证
We now prove that SERVERLESSBFT guarantees safety and liveness. As the shim nodes employ PBFT protocol, we borrow the following proposition guaranteed by PBFT.
我们现在证明 SERVERLESSBFT 可以保证安全性和活跃性。由于 shim 节点采用 PBFT 协议，我们借用 PBFT 保证的以下命题。
Proposition VII.1. Let Ri,i∈{1,2} ,be two honest shim nodes that committed ⟨Ti⟩Ci as the k -th transaction of view v. If nR>3fR ,then ⟨T1⟩C1=⟨T2⟩C2.
命题 VII.1。令 Ri,i∈{1,2} 为两个诚实的 shim 节点，将 ⟨Ti⟩Ci 提交为视图 v 的第 k 事务。如果 nR>3fR ，则 < b4>
Theorem VII.2. Given an architecture A={C,R,E,S,V} , if the number of byzantine shim nodes and byzantine server- less executors are bounded by fR and fE ,respectively,then SERVERLESSBFT protocol guarantees safety.
定理VII.2。给定一个架构 A={C,R,E,S,V} ，如果拜占庭 shim 节点和拜占庭无服务器执行器的数量分别受 fR 和 fE 限制，则 SERVERLESSBFT 协议保证安全。
Proof. Prior to proving this,we note that as the verifier V is trusted,storage S will be updated in the order agreed by 2fR+1 of shim nodes. We prove the rest as follows:
证明。在证明这一点之前，我们注意到，由于验证者 V 是可信的，存储 S 将按照shim节点 2fR+1 同意的顺序更新。我们证明其余部分如下：
Non-conflicting transactions. If the primary P is honest, then from Proposition VII.1, we can conclude that no two shim nodes will commit different transactions at the same sequence number and P will spawn 2fE+1 executors. These transactions will persist across views as in any view-change quorum of 2fR+1 replicas,there will be one honest replica that has executed this request. If P is byzantine and assigns two or more requests the same sequence number k ,then from Proposition VII.1, we know that P will not be successful. If the byzantine P sends the PREPREPARE for some T to less than 2fR+1 replicas,this transaction will not commit. As a result, at least fR+1 replicas will timeout and a VIEWCHANGE will take place. The new primary waits for VIEWCHANGE messages from 2fR+1 replicas,and uses these messages to create a NEWVIEW message. This NEWVIEW message includes a list of requests for each sequence number present in the VIEWCHANGE message. Each replica on receiving the NEWVIEW message can verify its contents and update its state.
不冲突的交易。如果主 P 是诚实的，那么根据命题 VII.1，我们可以得出结论，没有两个 shim 节点会以相同的序列号提交不同的事务，并且 P 将生成 2fE+1 执行者。这些事务将跨视图持续存在，就像在 2fR+1 副本的任何视图更改仲裁中一样，将有一个诚实的副本执行此请求。如果 P 是拜占庭式的，并且为两个或多个请求分配相同的序列号 k ，那么从命题VII.1我们知道P不会成功。如果拜占庭 P 将某些 T 的 PREPREPARE 发送到少于 2fR+1 个副本，则该事务将不会提交。因此，至少 fR+1 个副本将超时，并且将发生 VIEWCHANGE。新的主节点等待来自 2fR+1 副本的 VIEWCHANGE 消息，并使用这些消息创建 NEWVIEW 消息。该 NEWVIEW 消息包括针对 VIEWCHANGE 消息中存在的每个序列号的请求列表。每个副本在接收到 NEWVIEW 消息后都可以验证其内容并更新其状态。
Conflicting transactions with unknown read-write sets. In the case of conflicting transactions, the only additional attack a byzantine primary P can do is to get a transaction aborted by delaying spawning executors. However, as P does not know, which transactions are conflicting, this is all based on a guess. Note: this attack does not make the data-store unsafe.
与未知读写集发生冲突的事务。在事务冲突的情况下，拜占庭主 P 可以做的唯一额外攻击是通过延迟生成执行器来中止事务。然而，由于 P 不知道哪些交易存在冲突，所以这一切都基于猜测。注意：此攻击不会使数据存储变得不安全。
Theorem VII.3. Given an architecture A={C,R,E,S,V} , if the network is reliable and the number of byzantine shim nodes and serverless executors are bounded by fR and fE , respectively, then SERVERLESSBFT guarantees liveness.
定理VII.3。给定一个架构 A={C,R,E,S,V} ，如果网络可靠并且拜占庭 shim 节点和无服务器执行器的数量分别受 fR 和 fE 限制，则 SERVERLESSBFT 保证活力。
Proof. Prior to proving this,we note that as the verifier V is trusted,so if it receives 2fE+1 matching VERIFY messages with correct read-write sets, it will send a reply to the client. We prove the rest as follows:
证明。在证明这一点之前，我们注意到，由于验证者 V 是可信的，因此如果它收到具有正确读写集的 2fE+1 匹配的 VERIFY 消息，它将向客户端发送回复。我们证明其余部分如下：
Non-conflicting transactions. If the primary P is honest,then every transaction will be committed by at least 2fR+1 shim nodes. P will use this to create a certificate and spawn 2fE+1 executors and V will receive fE+1 matching responses.
不冲突的交易。如果主 P 是诚实的，则每个事务将由至少 2fR+1 个 shim 节点提交。 P 将使用它来创建证书并生成 2fE+1 执行器，并且 V 将接收 fE+1 匹配的响应。
If P is byzantine,it can perform one of the many types of request suspension attacks described in Section V-A. For each such attack,either the client C or the nodes in R will timeout. This will force P to either ensure consensus of C ’s transaction, or be replaced through the view-change protocol. Post view- change, if the subsequent primary is also byzantine, then it will also be eventually replaced. This process can happen at most fR consecutive times,after which the system will be live. In the case a byzantine primary P attempts to keep up to fR nodes in dark,then using the featherweight checkpoint protocol these nodes will be brought to the same state.
如果 P 是拜占庭式的，它可以执行第V-A节中描述的多种类型的请求挂起攻击之一。对于每次此类攻击，客户端 C 或 R 中的节点都会超时。这将迫使 P 确保 C 事务的共识，或者通过视图更改协议进行替换。视图更改后，如果后续主节点也是拜占庭式的，那么它最终也将被替换。此过程最多可以连续发生 fR 次，之后系统将上线。如果拜占庭主 P 尝试将最多 fR 个节点保持在黑暗状态，则使用轻量级检查点协议，这些节点将进入相同的状态。
Conflicting transactions with unknown read-write sets. In the case of conflicting transactions, the only additional attack a byzantine primary P can do is to spawn less than 3fE+1 . In such a case,if the verifier V receives less than 2fE+1 VERIFY messages,such that less than fE+1 are matching, V ’s timer τm will timeout and it will send a REPLACE message to the shim nodes. For other cases, V will send the client a RESPONSE or ABORT message depending on if it receives fE+1 matching VERIFY messages.
与未知读写集发生冲突的事务。在交易冲突的情况下，拜占庭主 P 唯一可以做的额外攻击是生成小于 3fE+1 的攻击。在这种情况下，如果验证者 V 收到少于 2fE+1 个VERIFY消息，使得少于 fE+1 匹配， V '计时器 τm 将超时，并将向 shim 节点发送 REPLACE 消息。对于其他情况， V 将向客户端发送 RESPONSE 或 ABORT 消息，具体取决于它是否收到 fE+1 匹配的 VERIFY 消息。
To gauge the practicality of our vision of a BFT serverless- edge architecture, we implement and evaluate our design.
为了衡量 BFT 无服务器边缘架构愿景的实用性，我们实施并评估了我们的设计。
Shim. As the shim nodes represent edge devices, which may have access to limited resources, we want the shim nodes to have a lightweight BFT implementation. So, on each shim node, we install RESILIENTDB's node architecture [17], [26], [27], [40], [52], [53]. ResilientDB provides access to a multi-threaded, pipelined, and modular architecture for designing BFT applications. 3 The codebase is written in C++ and we deploy RESILIENTDB's PBFT protocol at the shim. Clients also employ C++ to create YCSB transactions (refer Section IX) and use NNG [54] sockets for communication.
垫姆。由于 shim 节点代表边缘设备，可能可以访问有限的资源，因此我们希望 shim 节点具有轻量级 BFT 实现。因此，在每个 shim 节点上，我们安装 RESILIENTDB 的节点架构 [17]、[26]、[27]、[40]、[52]、[53]。 ResilientDB 提供对多线程、流水线和模块化架构的访问，以设计 BFT 应用程序。 3 代码库是用 C++ 编写的，我们在 shim 上部署了 RESILIENTDB 的 PBFT 协议。客户端还使用 C++ 创建 YCSB 事务（请参阅第 IX 节）并使用 NNG [54] 套接字进行通信。
Invoker. At each shim node, we deploy an invoker to spawn nE executors when indicated by the node’s consensus instance. RESILIENTDB provides at each node an execute- thread, which calls invoker as soon as a request is committed. Our implementation of the invoker is written in Go [55] using the AWS SDK for Go. Further, our invoker does not wait for the spawned executors to finish and proceeds to spawn the executors for the next client request.
祈求者。在每个 shim 节点上，我们部署一个调用程序来在节点的共识实例指示时生成 nE 执行器。 RESILIENTDB 在每个节点提供一个执行线程，一旦提交请求，该线程就会调用调用程序。我们的调用器实现是使用适用于 Go 的 AWS 开发工具包以 Go [55] 编写的。此外，我们的调用程序不会等待生成的执行程序完成，而是继续为下一个客户端请求生成执行程序。
Serverless Function. Each AWS Lambda executor receives a function written in C++ that includes the client transaction. This function instructs the executor to: (i) verify the certificate C ,(ii) execute the transaction,(iii) fetch necessary read-write sets from the storage database, and (iv) send the result to the verifier. We encode the communication between the Lambda function and the verifier in a stateless HTTP request. We use CryptoPP[56] library for digital signatures and verification and use CPR[57] to create and send HTTP requests.
无服务器功能。每个 AWS Lambda 执行程序都会收到一个用 C++ 编写的函数，其中包含客户端事务。该函数指示执行器：（i）验证证书 C ，（ii）执行交易，（iii）从存储数据库获取必要的读写集，以及（iv）将结果发送到验证者。我们将 Lambda 函数和验证者之间的通信编码为无状态 HTTP 请求。我们使用 CryptoPP[56] 库进行数字签名和验证，并使用 CPR[57] 创建和发送 HTTP 请求。
Verifier. We implement the verifier in Go and install a simple HTTP/Net webserver at the verifier for receiving the executor responses. Further, our verifier includes a hashmap to count the matching responses for each transaction. Post validation, the verifier uses NNG to send a response to the client.
验证者。我们在 Go 中实现验证器，并在验证器上安装一个简单的 HTTP/Net Web 服务器以接收执行器响应。此外，我们的验证器还包含一个哈希图来计算每个事务的匹配响应。验证后，验证者使用 NNG 向客户端发送响应。

我们的评估旨在回答以下有关我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议的问题。

(Q1) 客户端拥塞的影响？

(Q4) 昂贵的执行的影响？

(Q5) 全球范围内产生执行者的影响？
(Q6) Impact of resource limitations at edge devices?
（问题 6）边缘设备资源限制的影响？

(Q9) 任务卸载的影响？
Setup. We deploy the verifier, shim nodes, and clients on the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). These components use VM.Standard.E3.Flex architecture with 10GiB NICs. Each shim node has 16 cores and 16GiB RAM and the verifier has 8 cores. We use AWS Lambda Functions for spawning serverless executors in up to 11 regions in the following order: North
设置。我们在 Oracle 云基础设施 (OCI) 上部署验证程序、填充节点和客户端。这些组件使用带有 10GiB NIC 的 VM.Standard.E3.Flex 架构。每个 shim 节点有 16 个核心和 16GiB RAM，验证器有 8 个核心。我们使用 AWS Lambda 函数在最多 11 个区域中按以下顺序生成无服务器执行器： 北
