California, Oregon, Ohio, Canada, Frankfurt, Ireland, London, Paris, Stockholm, Seoul, and Singapore. In our experiments, we use up to 128 shim nodes and 21 executors. We run each experiment for 180 seconds with 60 seconds warmup time and report the average results over three runs.
加利福尼亚州、俄勒冈州、俄亥俄州、加拿大、法兰克福、爱尔兰、伦敦、巴黎、斯德哥尔摩、首尔和新加坡。在我们的实验中，我们使用多达 128 个 shim 节点和 21 个执行器。我们每个实验运行 180 秒，预热时间为 60 秒，并报告三次运行的平均结果。
Unless explicitly stated, we use the following setup. We require the primary node to spawn 3 AWS Lambda executors, each of which is spawned in a distinct region. Further, we deploy up to 80k clients on 4OCI machines to concurrently issue requests. Each client waits for a response prior to sending its next request. We also require clients and edge nodes to employ batching and run consensuses on batches of 100 client transactions. The size of each type of message communi- cated is: PREPREPARE (5392 B), PREPARE (216B), COMMIT (220 B), Execute (3320 B), and Response (2270B).
除非明确说明，否则我们使用以下设置。我们要求主节点生成 3 个 AWS Lambda 执行程序，每个执行程序都生成在不同的区域中。此外，我们在 4OCI 台计算机上部署最多 80k 个客户端以同时发出请求。每个客户端在发送下一个请求之前都会等待响应。我们还要求客户端和边缘节点采用批处理并对 100 个客户端事务的批次运行共识。每种类型的通信消息的大小为： PREPREPARE (5392 B)、PREPARE (216B)、COMMIT (220 B)、Execute (3320 B) 和 Response (2270B)。
Benchmark. To evaluate our serverless-edge architecture across different parameters, for some experiments, we need to fix the number of shim nodes. We learn from existing database literature, specifically the Blockbench [58] paper, and select two configurations. SERVBFT-8: Medium size shim with 8 nodes. SERVBFT-32: Large size shim with 32 nodes (maximum number of nodes in any Blockbench experiment).
基准。为了跨不同参数评估我们的无服务器边缘架构，对于某些实验，我们需要固定填充节点的数量。我们从现有的数据库文献中学习，特别是 Blockbench [58] 论文，并选择两种配置。 SERVBFT-8：具有 8 个节点的中型垫片。 SERVBFT-32：具有 32 个节点的大尺寸垫片（任何 Blockbench 实验中的最大节点数）。
Similarly, we adopt the popular Yahoo Cloud Serving Benchmark (YCSB) from Blockbench suite, which has also been used by several prior works in database literature for designing transactions [17], [49], [58], [59], [60]. We use YCSB to create key-value transactions that access a database of 600k records. Specifically,our transactions perform read and write operations. With regards to edge applications, these transactions represent user transactions that require access to existing records in the storage.
同样，我们采用 Blockbench 套件中流行的雅虎云服务基准（YCSB），该基准也被数据库文献中的一些先前作品用于设计事务 [17]、[49]、[58]、[59]、[60] ]。我们使用 YCSB 创建访问 600k 记录数据库的键值事务。具体来说，我们的事务执行读取和写入操作。对于边缘应用程序，这些事务代表需要访问存储中现有记录的用户事务。

A. Impact of Client Congestion
A. 客户端拥塞的影响

In Figure 5, we vary the number of deployed clients from 2k to 88k . For the first five data-points on the graph,we double the number of clients and for succeeding points, we increase the number of clients by 8k . Initially,an increase in the number of clients causes an increase in system throughput, post which the throughput saturates. This happens because each entity in our serverless-edge architecture has to now do more work than before, which causes an increase in com- putational and communication costs. As a result, the latency keeps increasing as each request spends a longer time in the architecture. Hence, SERVBFT-8 outperforms SERVBFT-32 as fewer nodes are involved in each consensus, which implies smaller wait time for each request. Summary: We observe that
在图 5 中，我们将部署的客户端数量从 2k 更改为 88k 。对于图表上的前五个数据点，我们将客户端数量加倍，对于后续点，我们将客户端数量增加 8k 。最初，客户端数量的增加导致系统吞吐量增加，之后吞吐量饱和。发生这种情况是因为我们的无服务器边缘架构中的每个实体现在都必须比以前做更多的工作，这导致计算和通信成本增加。因此，随着每个请求在架构中花费更长的时间，延迟不断增加。因此，SERVBFT-8 优于 SERVBFT-32，因为每个共识涉及的节点较少，这意味着每个请求的等待时间更短。摘要：我们观察到
3 RESILIENTDB is open-sourced at https://resilientdb.com/.
3 RESILIENTDB 在 https://resilientdb.com/ 上开源。
Fig. 6. Benchmarking throughput attained and latency incurred by the BFT Serverless-Edge architecture.
图 6. BFT 无服务器边缘架构获得的吞吐量和延迟的基准测试。
initially SERVBFT-8 attains up to 1.6× more throughput and 1.2× less latency than SERVBFT-32. However,on increas- ing the number of clients,the gap increases to 2.8× more throughput and 2.71× less latency.
最初，SERVBFT-8 比 SERVBFT-32 获得 1.6× 更高的吞吐量和 1.2× 更少的延迟。然而，随着客户端数量的增加，差距会增加到 2.8× 更高的吞吐量和 2.71× 更少的延迟。

B. Impact of Executors B. 执行者的影响

In Figures 6(i) and 6(ii), we vary the number of serverless executors spawned by the primary node: 3,5,11,15 ,and 21 . For these experiments, we spawned executors in up to seven regions and tried to evenly split these executors across these regions. These figures illustrate that an increase in the number of executors causes a decrease in throughput and an increase in latency. Although all the executors process the requests in parallel, there is an increase in the task of spawning at the primary and increase in validation at the verifier. Further, as executors are spread across distinct regions, the reduced bandwidth and increased ping costs delays communication. Summary: At 3 executors,SERVBFT-8 attains 2.59× more throughput and 43% less latency than SERVBFT-32,while at 15 executors, 47% more throughput and 5% less latency.
在图 6(i) 和 6(ii) 中，我们改变了主节点生成的无服务器执行器的数量： 3,5,11,15 和 21 。对于这些实验，我们在多达七个区域中生成了执行器，并尝试将这些执行器平均分配到这些区域中。这些数字说明执行器数量的增加会导致吞吐量下降和延迟增加。尽管所有执行器并行处理请求，但在主执行器处生成的任务有所增加，并且在验证器处的验证也有所增加。此外，由于执行器分布在不同的区域，带宽的减少和 ping 成本的增加会延迟通信。摘要：在 3 个执行器时，SERVBFT-8 比 SERVBFT-32 获得 2.59× 更高的吞吐量和 43% 更少的延迟，而在 15 个执行器时， 47% 更高的吞吐量和< b4> 更少的延迟。

C. Impact of Batching C. 批处理的影响

In Figures 6(iii) and 6(iv), we vary the size of batch of client requests from 10 to 8k . With an increase in batch size, we first observe an increase in the system throughput followed by an eventual decrease. Although larger batches imply a corresponding decrease in the number of runs of the SERVERLESSBFT protocol, it substantially increases the costs of communicating batches across the shim nodes and executors. Further, larger batches are much more expensive to process for shim nodes and executors.
在图 6(iii) 和 6(iv) 中，我们将客户端请求批量的大小从 10 更改为 8k 。随着批量大小的增加，我们首先观察到系统吞吐量增加，然后最终减少。尽管较大的批次意味着 SERVERLESSBFT 协议的运行次数相应减少，但它大大增加了在 shim 节点和执行器之间通信批次的成本。此外，对于 shim 节点和执行器来说，处理更大的批次要昂贵得多。
Summary: From batch size 10 to 5k ,SERVBFT-8 observes an increase in throughput by 11.42× and SERVBFT-32 ob- serves an increase in throughput by 18.5× .
摘要：从批量大小 10 到 5k ，SERVBFT-8 观察到吞吐量增加了 11.42× ，SERVBFT-32 观察到吞吐量增加了 18.5× 。

D. Impact of Expensive Execution
D. 昂贵执行的影响

In Figures 6(v) and 6(vi), we test with transactions that require large execution time; we vary the time required for execution from few milliseconds to 8 seconds. As the time required to execute a transaction increases, the time required by the shim and the verifier to process this request becomes insignificant. Prior works show that such transactions or codes, which bottleneck the system throughput and latency are preva- lent [61]. This experiment also proves that our serverless- edge architecture introduces minimal costs to the applications that require large execution times. Summary: From execu- tion length of few milliseconds to 8 seconds, SERVBFT-8's throughput reduces by 74.5% and latency increases by 21× , while SERVBFT-32’s throughput reduces by 51% and latency increases by 13.6× .
在图 6(v) 和 6(vi) 中，我们使用需要大量执行时间的事务进行测试；我们将执行所需的时间从几毫秒更改为 8 秒。随着执行交易所需的时间增加，填充程序和验证者处理该请求所需的时间变得微不足道。先前的工作表明，此类事务或代码普遍存在，它们是系统吞吐量和延迟的瓶颈[61]。该实验还证明，我们的无服务器边缘架构为需要较长执行时间的应用程序带来了最小的成本。摘要：从几毫秒的执行长度到 8 秒，SERVBFT-8 的吞吐量减少了 74.5% ，延迟增加了 21× ，而 SERVBFT-32 的吞吐量减少了 51% 。

E. Impact of Spawning Executors across Globe
E. 全球范围内产生执行者的影响

In Figures 6(vii) and (viii), we require the primary node to spawn 11 executors in 5,7,9 ,and 11 regions; we vary the number of regions while spawning same number of executors. The primary node uses the round-robin protocol to spawn executors in each region. In this experiment, we want to observe the impact of system performance on increasing the
在图 6(vii) 和 (viii) 中，我们要求主节点在 5,7,9 和 11 个区域中生成 11 个执行器；我们改变区域的数量，同时产生相同数量的执行器。主节点使用循环协议在每个区域生成执行器。在这个实验中，我们想要观察系统性能对增加
Fig. 7. Comparing SERVERLESSBFT against our three baseline designs: SERVERLESSCFT, PBFT and NOSHIM.
图 7. 将 SERVERLESSBFT 与我们的三种基线设计进行比较：SERVERLESSCFT、PBFT 和 NOSHIM。
number of regions. We observe that the throughput and latency remain constant. The primary node spawns 11 executors (fE=5) ,so the verifier needs to wait for only fE+1=6 matching VERIFY messages. The first 6 messages received by the verifier (deployed at North California) are from nearby regions: North American and European.
区域数量。我们观察到吞吐量和延迟保持不变。主节点产生 11 个执行器 (fE=5) ，因此验证者只需等待 fE+1=6 匹配的 VERIFY 消息。验证器（部署在北加州）收到的前 6 条消息来自附近地区：北美和欧洲。

F. Impact of Computing Power
F. 算力的影响

We use Figures 6(ix) and 6(x) to limit the available com- puting resources at shim nodes. As shim nodes represent edge devices, these devices may have limited cores and memory. So we test the impact of this restricted hardware om SERVER- LESSBFT. Unsurprisingly, as we increase the number of available cores, the protocols achieve higher throughputs and lower latencies. This is the case because our shim nodes adopt the multi-threaded pipelined architecture of RESILIENTDB, which performs better with an increase in available cores.
我们使用图 6(ix) 和 6(x) 来限制 shim 节点的可用计算资源。由于填充节点代表边缘设备，这些设备可能具有有限的核心和内存。因此，我们测试了这种受限硬件对 SERVER-LESSBFT 的影响。毫不奇怪，随着我们增加可用核心的数量，协议实现了更高的吞吐量和更低的延迟。之所以会出现这种情况，是因为我们的 shim 节点采用了 RESILIENTDB 的多线程流水线架构，随着可用核心的增加，性能会更好。
Summary: From experiments at 2 cores to 16 cores, SERVBFT-8’s throughput increases by 6× and latency de- creases by 70% ,while SERVBFT-32’s throughput increases by 5× and latency decreases by 64% .
总结：从2核到16核的实验来看，SERVBFT-8的吞吐量增加了 6× ，延迟减少了 70% ，而SERVBFT-32的吞吐量增加了 5× 且延迟时间减少 64% 。

G. Impact of Conflicting Transactions
G. 冲突交易的影响

We now vary the degree of transactional conflicts from 0 to 50% and illustrate our findings in Figures 6(xi) and 6(xii). As the read-write sets are unknown, the primary node cannot lock the conflicting data-items. As a result, some transactions get aborted at the verifier. This leads to an expected observation-a decrease in throughput with an increase in the rate of conflicts. However, the latency remains unchanged as the response time for the client remains the same.
现在，我们将事务冲突的程度从 0 更改为 50% ，并在图 6(xi) 和 6(xii) 中说明我们的发现。由于读写集未知，主节点无法锁定冲突的数据项。结果，一些交易在验证者处被中止。这导致了预期的观察结果——吞吐量随着冲突率的增加而下降。但是，由于客户端的响应时间保持不变，因此延迟保持不变。
Summary: From 0% conflicting transactions to 50% con- flicting,SERVBFT-8’s throughput decreases by 43% ,and SERVBFT-32's throughput decreases by 46% .
总结：从 0% 冲突事务到 50% 冲突，SERVBFT-8的吞吐量减少了 43% ，SERVBFT-32的吞吐量减少了 46%

H. Shim Scalability H. 垫片可扩展性

Until now, in all the experiments, we ran the PBFT protocol at the shim. So, we create three baseline designs to compare against SERVERLESSBFT:
到目前为止，在所有实验中，我们都在垫片上运行 PBFT 协议。因此，我们创建了三个基线设计来与 SERVERLESSBFT 进行比较：
(a) NOSHIM- Represents the experiment where there is no shim; no BFT consensus takes place. All the clients send their requests to a node, which instantaneously spawns executors.
(a) NOSHIM-代表没有垫片的实验；没有达成 BFT 共识。所有客户端将其请求发送到一个节点，该节点立即生成执行器。
(b) SERVERLESSCFT- Represents the experiment where the shim nodes employ a crash fault-tolerant (CFT) like Paxos [32] for consensus. As CFT protocols do not protect
(b) SERVERLESSCFT - 代表 shim 节点采用像 Paxos [32] 这样的崩溃容错 (CFT) 来达成共识的实验。由于 CFT 协议不保护
Fig. 8. Comparing our serverless-edge model against PBFT. Here, ET refers to number of execution threads assigned to specific PBFT implementation.
图 8. 将我们的无服务器边缘模型与 PBFT 进行比较。这里，ET指的是分配给特定PBFT实现的执行线程的数量。
against byzantine attacks, they do not require cryptographic signatures, which in turn reduces the amount of work done per consensus. Further, unlike PBFT, Paxos is linear.
针对拜占庭攻击，它们不需要加密签名，这反过来又减少了每个共识所完成的工作量。此外，与 PBFT 不同，Paxos 是线性的。
(c) PBFT- We also test our SERVERLESSBFT protocol against a BFT system (e.g. RESILIENTDB) running the PBFT protocol. In this system, we assume each node is a replica and executes the request in the agreed order post consensus [16], [17]. As a result, there are no costs associated with spawning executors and waiting for verifier to validate the requests.
(c) PBFT - 我们还针对运行 PBFT 协议的 BFT 系统（例如 RESILIENTDB）测试我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议。在这个系统中，我们假设每个节点都是一个副本，并在达成共识后按照商定的顺序执行请求[16]、[17]。因此，不存在与生成执行器和等待验证器验证请求相关的成本。
In these experiments, we also gauge how the shim scales with an increase in the number of edge devices. For this purpose, we vary the number of shim nodes from 4 to 128 . We use Figure 7 to illustrate the throughput and latency metrics and observe the following order for throughput attained:
在这些实验中，我们还测量了垫片如何随着边缘设备数量的增加而扩展。为此，我们将垫片节点的数量从 4 更改为 128 。我们使用图 7 来说明吞吐量和延迟指标，并观察所达到的吞吐量的以下顺序：
SERVERLESSBFT < PBFT < SERVERLESSCFT < NOSHIM
无服务器 SBFT < PBFT < 无服务器 SCFT < NOSHIM
NOSHIM has a constant throughput because there is no change in the number of shim nodes. Moreover, PBFT performs slightly better than our SERVERLESSBFT protocol. This im- plies that the verifier and executors do not adversely impact the throughput of PBFT. Finally, SERVERLESSCFT outperforms PBFT, which implies that the throughput of the serverless- edge architecture can be increased by replacing PBFT with faster consensus protocols. Summary: SERVERLESSBFT and SERVERLESSCFT achieve up to 22% less throughput and 1.25× more throughput than PBFT,respectively.
NOSHIM 具有恒定的吞吐量，因为 shim 节点的数量没有变化。此外，PBFT 的性能比我们的 SERVERLESSBFT 协议稍好一些。这意味着验证者和执行者不会对 PBFT 的吞吐量产生不利影响。最后，SERVERLESSCFT 优于 PBFT，这意味着可以通过用更快的共识协议替换 PBFT 来增加无服务器边缘架构的吞吐量。摘要：与 PBFT 相比，SERVERLESSBFT 和 SERVERLESSCFT 分别实现了 22% 少的吞吐量和 1.25× 多的吞吐量。

I. Impact of Task Offloading
一、任务卸载的影响

We use Figure 8 to illustrate the benefits of employing our serverless-edge model. Specifically, we introduce compute- intensive tasks (increasing execution time) and compare the peak throughput and monetary costs against setups where all the computations (PBFT consensus and transaction execution) are done on the edge devices (no serverless). For this ex- periment, we compare our SERVBFT-32 with 3 serverless executors against a PBFT shim with 32 nodes.
我们使用图 8 来说明采用无服务器边缘模型的好处。具体来说，我们引入计算密集型任务（增加执行时间），并将峰值吞吐量和货币成本与所有计算（PBFT 共识和交易执行）在边缘设备（无无服务器）上完成的设置进行比较。在本实验中，我们将具有 3 个无服务器执行器的 SERVBFT-32 与具有 32 个节点的 PBFT 垫片进行比较。
We make two observations: (1) If transactions can be exe- cuted in parallel, our serverless-edge model is only bounded by the rate of consensus and the number of executors that can be spawned in parallel. This is in contrast to setups where shim performs all tasks and becomes resource-bounded, which adversely decreases the throughput. To further validate this resource-boundedness, we calculate monetary costs of these experiments (in cents/ktxn) and use the precise costs for
我们做出两个观察：（1）如果事务可以并行执行，我们的无服务器边缘模型仅受共识率和可以并行生成的执行器数量的限制。这与 shim 执行所有任务并变得资源有限的设置相反，这会不利地降低吞吐量。为了进一步验证这种资源有限性，我们计算了这些实验的货币成本（以美分/ktxn为单位），并使用精确的成本
spawning serverless executors at AWS Lambda and running machines on OCI. Resource-boundedness increases monetary costs as machines need to be run for a larger period of time to complete the same set of transactions. (2) Serverless clouds permit selecting optimal hardware. To illustrate this, for experiments where shim does all tasks, we vary the number of execution threads (ET) at shim nodes (1,8,16) . If the available hardware has few cores, then a smaller set of transactions (1 or 8) can execute in parallel, which impacts throughput. Alternatively, an enterprise can require edge devices to have more cores (16), which may be underutilized if there is less available parallelism. X. Related Work
在 AWS Lambda 上生成无服务器执行器并在 OCI 上运行机器。资源有限会增加货币成本，因为机器需要运行更长的时间才能完成同一组交易。 (2) 无服务器云允许选择最佳硬件。为了说明这一点，对于 shim 执行所有任务的实验，我们改变 shim 节点 (1,8,16) 处的执行线程 (ET) 数量。如果可用硬件的内核很少，则可以并行执行较小的一组事务（1 或 8），这会影响吞吐量。或者，企业可能要求边缘设备具有更多核心 (16)，如果可用并行性较少，这些核心可能无法得到充分利用。十、相关工作
Edge computing is a decade old problem for which prior works have presented several interesting solutions [62], [63], [64], [65], [66]. These solutions aim to reduce latency for edge applications, but they cannot handle byzantine attacks and require developers to perform managerial tasks.
边缘计算是一个十年前的问题，之前的工作已经提出了几个有趣的解决方案[62]、[63]、[64]、[65]、[66]。这些解决方案旨在减少边缘应用程序的延迟，但它们无法处理拜占庭攻击，并且需要开发人员执行管理任务。
In recent years, Serverless computing has also gained a lot of interest with the aim of offloading the managerial tasks such as server provisioning and resource scaling to the cloud provider while the developer only uploads the code required to be executed [15], [38]. Prior works have presented novel solutions in this direction: AFT [14] introduces a shim to make stateful executors consistent; and Faasm [67] aims to design efficient stateful executors. However, neither these works target edge applications, nor they consider byzantine attacks.
近年来，无服务器计算也引起了人们的广泛兴趣，其目的是将服务器配置和资源扩展等管理任务卸载给云提供商，而开发人员只需上传需要执行的代码[15]，[38] 。之前的工作已经在这个方向上提出了新颖的解决方案：AFT [14] 引入了一个垫片来使状态执行器保持一致； Faasm [67] 旨在设计高效的有状态执行器。然而，这些工作既不针对边缘应用程序，也不考虑拜占庭攻击。
To design applications that can handle byzantine attacks, existing works have employed Byzantine Fault-Tolerant con- sensus protocols in the context of blockchain technology [19], [46], [68], [69], [70], [71], [72], [73], [74], [75], [76]. These applications assume that a set of nodes holding the same data run a BFT protocol. Each committed transaction is noted in an append-only ledger, blockchain, which can be queried in future to track transactions. EdgeChain [4] introduces a blockchain layer in the edge-compute model, which allocates the resources to edge devices. However, it does not tackle byzantine attacks from edge-clouds. Bajoudah et al [77] introduce a blockchain- based edge model where IOT devices maintain the blockchain. Blockene [78] wants to allow mobile devices to participate in blockchain consensus by delegating all the storage, computa- tion, and communication tasks to a set of powerful servers.
为了设计可以处理拜占庭攻击的应用程序，现有的工作在区块链技术的背景下采用了拜占庭容错共识协议[19]，[46]，[68]，[69]，[70]，[71] 、[72]、[73]、[74]、[75]、[76]。这些应用程序假设一组持有相同数据的节点运行 BFT 协议。每笔提交的交易都记录在一个仅附加的分类账、区块链中，将来可以查询以跟踪交易。 EdgeChain [4] 在边缘计算模型中引入了区块链层，该层将资源分配给边缘设备。然而，它并不能解决来自边缘云的拜占庭攻击。 Bajoudah 等人[77]引入了一种基于区块链的边缘模型，其中物联网设备维护区块链。 Blockene [78]希望通过将所有存储、计算和通信任务委托给一组强大的服务器来允许移动设备参与区块链共识。
Aslanpur et al. [79] present the vision of a serverless- edge framework. Their proposal does not assign tasks to edge devices and delegates all jobs to the serverless cloud. Further, there is no discussion on handling byzantine failures. More- over, their vision is neither implemented nor does their paper present any evaluation. Baresi et al. [80] present a similar design, but their design focusses on mobile computing. They do present a small evaluation of their design, but neither is their code available, nor do they make use of actual serverless cloud providers (like AWS). Their design delegates everything to the mobile edge servers (where they create a serverless cloud) and does not handle byzantine failures. Our NoShim experiment (Figure 7) approximates their architecture. In comparison, our serverless-edge co-design handles byzantine attacks, permits edge devices to select any serverless provider in vicinity, offloads compute-intensive tasks to cloud while allowing light-weight ordering on edge devices. XI. CONCLUSIONS
阿斯兰普尔等人。 [79]提出了无服务器边缘框架的愿景。他们的提案不会将任务分配给边缘设备，而是将所有作业委托给无服务器云。此外，没有讨论处理拜占庭故障。此外，他们的愿景既没有得到实现，他们的论文也没有提出任何评估。巴雷西等人。 [80]提出了类似的设计，但他们的设计重点是移动计算。他们确实对其设计进行了小型评估，但他们的代码既不可用，也没有使用实际的无服务器云提供商（如 AWS）。他们的设计将一切委托给移动边缘服务器（他们在其中创建无服务器云），并且不处理拜占庭故障。我们的 NoShim 实验（图 7）近似于他们的架构。相比之下，我们的无服务器边缘协同设计可以处理拜占庭攻击，允许边缘设备选择附近的任何无服务器提供商，将计算密集型任务卸载到云，同时允许在边缘设备上进行轻量级排序。十一.结论
In this paper, we presented SERVERLESSBFT, the first protocol to guarantee Byzantine Fault-Tolerant transactional flow among edge devices and serverless functions. SERVER- LESSBFT facilitates collaboration among edge devices, which spawn serverless executors at one or more cloud providers in their vicinity to process compute-intensive operations. Our proposed architecture ensures that only consistent updates are written to the database. We also present solutions to resolve various attacks on our proposed architecture. Our extensive evaluation illustrates that our architecture is scalable and is a good fit for the emerging edge applications.
在本文中，我们提出了 SERVERLESSBFT，这是第一个保证边缘设备和无服务器功能之间拜占庭容错事务流的协议。无服务器 SBFT 促进边缘设备之间的协作，边缘设备在附近的一个或多个云提供商处生成无服务器执行器来处理计算密集型操作。我们提出的架构确保只有一致的更新才会写入数据库。我们还提出了解决方案来解决对我们提出的架构的各种攻击。我们的广泛评估表明，我们的架构具有可扩展性，非常适合新兴的边缘应用程序。
